Reviews.Title: “A Strange Quirk”
Reviews.Author: gtsaperstein
Reviews.Content: We're in Sydney now in a beautiful Harbor View suite on the 7th floor. The view of the ever-changing harbor and the Sydney bridge is spectacular, although it doesn't come cheap [$1,500/night], and the proximity to the Opera House and quay is unparalleled. I can't, however, give the hotel five stars for one quirky reason: The thermostat has only two settings---21 degrees Celsius [70 degrees F] and 25 degrees Celsius [77 degrees F]. My wife and I normally sleep at 62 to 65 degrees F, but you can't turn the thermostat in this room below 70. WTF? So, we have to keep the door to the outdoor patio open at night, which works, except you hear the noise of the harbor and people walking below and light comes in at 6 am. The other hotel in Sydney which has a comparable location is the Park Hyatt, which is closer to the bridge, but farther from the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views and great service”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan_Case
Reviews.Content: Every year for my birthday we go to Sydney for a break. We have been staying at the Quay Grand Suites now for the last three years. I love the location - every balcony has a view. I love waking up to the surprise of a magnificent cruise ship docked across the Quay. Watching the ferries come and go all day long is fabulous too. The bar windows opens up and you are right on the Quay. The atmosphere is fabulous. The rooms are great - I love having a washing machine and dryer on hand. The service has always been fabulous there. This year was especially fun because of Boi. He was always smiling and genuinely interested in what was happening. The heated pool and spa is fabulous too. I recommend this place very highly. Siobhan Case

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Jane W
Reviews.Content: Really loved my accomodation, great area, room very clean

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Miss_M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in early January. I was worried that being a 5 star hotel we would come across snobby people and staff but the people who worked here were amazing. Very friendly and helpful. We mentioned we were on our honeymoon on check-in and after coming back from an afternoon out we found a bottle of sparkling wine on the table. The view was absolutely fabulous and the vibe of Circular Quay at night was amazing. The only little thing that bothered me was one of the cushions was dirty but I find this at every hotel and could be easily missed by cleaners. Never came across any cockroaches that people have mentioned in other reviews. One thing I absolutely recommend is ordering the chocolate-coated strawberries - Yum! A great experience, maybe a little expensive but very worth it due to the view and convenience of location. A very short walk to ferries and train station make it easy to get around Sydney. Can't wait to stay here again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the location and the view!”
Reviews.Author: Irene020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Quay Grand Hotel in Sydney as much for the excellent location and fabulous view of the harbour as for the intelligent and comfortable layout of the space inside the suites. We pay the extra and get the harbour-side room rather than the garden-side room. It is definitely worth it. Each suite has a kitchen with washing machine and clothes dryer, biggish refrigerator, oven, dishwasher, coffee-maker as well as the usual kettle and toaster. The bathroom has both shower and spa. There is a dining area slightly separated from the lounge area; a bedroom with queen / king size bed and desk for laptop - we had complimentary internet access - and a balcony with small table and two chairs. We have not yet eaten in the hotel restaurant, so cannot pass comment on the standard of their food, but the little bar has fairly good bar food and a wonderful painting by Australian artist Marion Borgelt. It is just a short stroll along the quay to the Opera House if you want theatre, opera and dance. There is also a Dendy movie theatre about half-way to the Opera House and several good food places on the way. We chose this time to eat at a new-found gem in Balmain (review to come) as the weather was so good and the multipass travel tickets so reasonable that a ferry there and a bus to return was pleasant and relaxing. I do have one quibble with this hotel - one that stops me giving it an "excellent" rating. The bathroom floors have been very poorly designed and in each of our three or four visits, we have had a room where the water from the shower spills out into the main bathroom area and must be mopped up with the floor mat. The tap water from the basin also tends to spill out onto the vanity top rather than be completely caught by the basin. This can make for a wetter experience than we would like for a top-end hotel. However; it is a small irritation and can not take away completely from what is otherwise a fantastic hotel stay. If you are looking for the complete Sydney experience and are able to give yourselves a wonderful lift, gift or surprise, I can recommend the Quay Grand. Tip: Keep a look out on wotif.com (http://www.wotif.com/hotels/australia-sydney-hotels.html) as this hotel often has very good specials.

Reviews.Title: “One word FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: estelle80
Reviews.Content: Agree with 'melwollongong' location, location! This is just the most fabulous place to stay. We came to meet friends arriving by ship at Circ Quay and had the joy of watching their ship berth at the overseas terminal from our balcony. That was just to begin with. The suite was wonderful every amenity one could wish for plus lots of room. This together with a well equipped gym and good size swimming pool. The location so near to Sydney's main attractions is amazing. and the staff - went out of their way to be helpful. Such a great experience we are returning in about two week's time - this time for 10 days - last visit, just four days, was not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: melwollongong
Reviews.Content: Location, location! Great views of the harbour bridge. Shopping and restaurants on your doorstep. Room was spacious and well equipped. Breakfast was great quality with nice views.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Adelaidequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Quay apartments in March 2012. Room 608. I had great expectations for our visit, however, I was a tad disappointed. The reception area is really basic, however, the staff were very pleasant at all times. At a cost of $1338 for two nights, definitely this apartment is not good value for money unless you need a kitchen and a laundry. The view of the harbour bridge is really lovely and it is interesting to watch the coming and goings of the Sydney Ferries at the terminal at Circular Quay. However its proximity to the Circular Quay railway station means that you get to hear the trains coming at going and at night, this didnâ€™t charm me. The dÃ©cor of the rooms was a bit dated however and lacked the wow factor. The pool area is nothing like it is portrayed in the photos and is a small pool and tiny gym with very little equipment. The Eco bar was so noisy with a DJ at night that we couldnâ€™t have a conversation so moved to the foyer. Eco bar hosts the breakfast in the morning and again this wasnâ€™t much to write home about. On the first morning, the repair man was fixing a floor to ceiling window that had come off it hinges so the room was freezing. Breakfast consisted of a continental buffet and hot food needs to be ordered separately. On both mornings the food was cold so overall a really disappointing breakfast and not what you would expect in 5 star accommodation. Overall, the apartment complex lacks soul and the wow factor and given there are so many other really good places to stay in Sydney, that also have a view of the harbour, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: BJS55
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here again. Our room was effectively a 1 bed apartment complete with kitchen which included a washing machine and a drier. Absolutely fab room with a great view of the bridge. Staff were extremely helpful and efficient. We had a slight problem with the bathroom but we were compensated for that as a matter of course.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler039
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suite 608 for three nights in early February. This modern, clean, one bedroom suite has a large living room, large bedroom, kitchen, laundry room with washer and dryer,nice balcony, and a great view of the perpetually busy harbor. It is at the city end of the hotel; the view from rooms farther north might be even better.There is tons of storage space and closets. Service exceptionally cheerful and good. An entrance to the lovely Botanic Garden is just across the street from the front door. We've stayed at many, many top hotels around the world and this is one of the best ever for size, quality, service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: phoenixjewel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights in mid-February and my experience was outstanding. The service was excellent - all of the front desk staff was always willing to help, answer questions, look up stuff online, order room service for me, and always with a friendly attitude. At check-in, I asked if I could "make a deal" on the Internet service charges since I was staying for a whole week, and was given the weekly WiFi package for free! I really appreciated this gesture since I was so far away from home and wanted to be able to stay in touch each day. (Plus, I had already paid a small fortune for my weekly stay!) The 1BDR suite was huge - I estimate close to 900 sqft. The $1,000+ I saved on booking a Garden View suite instead of Harbour View for the week I was glad to have saved since Sydney is so very expensive. The Garden View suite had nice views and it was very quiet. Maybe if I only stayed a couple of nights I would have sprung for Harbour View, however there are many cafes/benches outside of the hotel and a bar and restaurant within the hotel where you can enjoy the views at any time. Also, the pool area has a sitting area on an upper deck that overlooks the harbour as well. I was on the 7th floor, suite 709, a corner room. No earplugs needed at any time. The suite was very clean and the bed super comfortable. I used the in-suite washer/dryer twice and was grateful to have that amenity. I ordered room service on three different occasions and the food was very good and I never waited more than 15 minutes for delivery. The tap water tasted fine, so I kept refilling a couple of bottles to store in the fridge rather than buying bottled water (for $3-$4 a pop). The location, on the east side of Circular Quay, couldn't be better. Most of the activities I did involved taking ferries, and the wharf is just steps outside of the door of the hotel. I also enjoyed daily early morning walks around the Opera House, harbour area, and the Royal Botanical gardens. Lots of walkers/joggers out at sunrise, but no crowds so a great way to enjoy the views and see the Opera House up close (good exercise going up and down those steps, too). Also, only a 10-minute walk to The Rocks area, with good restaurants. Within a 5-minute walk are a Starbucks, convenience stores, fast food, and a few bars/restaurants if desired. I ate breakfast daily at a place called City Extra which was reasonably priced for Sydney (avg of $13 for breakfast) and was less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and offered outdoor seating with harbour views. I would highly recommend this hotel if you can afford it and if you are staying for an extended period. It is more comfortable to have an entire suite to relax in, rather than a cramped hotel room. If you sign up for the Mirvac Hotels e-mailing list, you can get good promotions (like 4th night free, or discounted rates).

Reviews.Title: “Location, amenities, and service”
Reviews.Author: American_in_Italy
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has been on a long trip through Australia will love the fact you have a washer and dryer in your suite! We had a 2 bedroom suite which while seemed enormous for just the two of us, we liked having the 2 baths and could use the extra bedroom to store our luggage and keep it out of the way. We had a corner room, which allowed you to see the opera house, park, and a corner of the harbor. While the hotel does't sweep you off your feet upon entering the lobby, it is very comfortable and you will love the location. It has a small exercise room, including a sauna and indoor pool, overlooking the Quay. Staff was very accommodating at booking us events, like the Bridgewalk. We had some small maintenance issues with the room, and because we stayed in the same room twice one week apart, it was disappointing that they were not fixed. (e.g. light flickering and shower head a bit floppy). I mentioned them upon check out the second time, and I am sure they will be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Disppointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Challenging
Reviews.Content: friend......My sisters and I stayed 3 nights aftr revieiwng Tripadvsiors' review on this property. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment overlooking the Harbour. The location of the property is nothing but perfect and the view is absolutely breathtaking. It it si the view one is after and the rest of the rpoeprty and service is not important then this is the place. We paid for a 5 star serviced apartment and expected a 5 star service.Considering what we paid it is expensive. On arrival at the reception while checking in I gave instruction to the staff to enquire on quotes for a car and chauffeur for a full day. to go to the vineyard and fruit picking. II had impressed on the guy that that is the nly free day we have and to please make sure I have a car. The guy assured me it will be done and he will leave whatever quotes he gets with his colleague. on returning later in teh evening, I discovered that a private tour guide was recommded for my use if I wanted and no quotes on any car and chauffeur. When we checked in the bathroom in the 2nd bedroom was not properly cleaned. I didnt do anyhting about it hoping that the maids will clean the bathroom the following day. When we returned the next day after lunch we noticed that the bathroom was cleaned at the top, towels changed and the beds were tidied in a hurry, the runner for the bed was left where we left it on the floor the night before. The floor of the bathroom was left as it was when we left. So I called housekeeping and someone by the name of "Dan" took my call. Having explained to her she sent a Nepalese help up to clean the floor. We were shocked at the amount of dust and hair that was swept out by this man. Finally the day before our departure I booked a van to take us to the airport. I approached the reception in the morning to arrange for the transport. The same assurance was given to me by staff that " it will be done". Again we returned at midday....I checked to make certain that transport was booked, A lady attended to me,.....she found nothing in the system....nevertheless she assurd me she will ratify this and book me a van. When we returned in the evening, we again found that no reservation was made for a van to take us to the airport. Finally the staff on duty that evening immediatelt booked the van and confirmed the same with me. Having had this experience I had to call the reception again the next mornng that the reervation was made.. The efficiency and friendliness of the staff at the restaurant is commendable. For us the service is short of a 5 satr.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: david1949
Reviews.Content: A five star hotel, with five star prices, but none of the stuffy formality you sometimes find with the 'big brands' in top tourist spots. Very friendly and helpful front-of-house staff. Can't beat the location, ferry and train connections metres away, and if you're going to the Opera House for a show, it's just 4 minutes walk. Plenty of dining options nearby, in all price ranges. Well set up kitchen and dining area in the suite, ideal if you want to self-cater. We got our own breakfast supplies in, in house was very expensive. WiFi extra charge, $45 for 3 days, but good speed and allowed multiple simultaneous logins.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney - the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: salrik
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights overlooking Sydney harbour and Circular Quay in a great apartment which had its own well equipped kitchen, including washing machine and dryer, dishwasher and microwave, full cooker etc. The location was fantastic, the hotel staff delightful and very helpful. Everything was in easy reach, from the local hotels and bars, to the ferries and local buses. My husband is disabled so being able to take the elevator directly down to Circular Quay plaza which is on the flat, he was able to move about easily. Hotel is opposite the Botanical gardens and Government house as an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: ollieboog
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights, in a spacious 1 bedroom, waterview apartment. The apartment was lovely, well-serviced, well-stocked and included a washer and dryer which turned out to be a real bonus. The view from the balcony was fantastic - watched the ferries and cruise ships come and go with the Harbour Bridge in the background. The Opera House is a few short steps from the hotel's front door, as are many sidewalk restaurants and shops. Oh, and the Royal Botanical Gardens are a short stroll away. The staff were extremely helpful and available. This place is expensive but everything in this part of Sydney is - we were glad we treated ourselves to a stay here. It's a wonderful jumping-off spot for tourist activities as the ferries, train and buses are a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewed the big 5 hotels - I know we pick the right place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganDavid
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to travel around this world and stay at some of the best hotels and resorts on six of the continents. We now have another hotel to add to our list of best places we have stayed at. The best in Sydney. In February, after a long cruise, my wife and I stayed at the Quay Grand Suites for three days. In my option, the Quay Grand has the best location for enjoying Sydney. Everything is very close - you are on the circular Quay: the Harbor Bridge, Opera House (three minute walk), Rocks (five minute walk), ferries, trains, buses (including Hop-On-Hop-Off and the free shuttle bus which we used to get to most ofl our sightseeing locations). It really is enjoyable to sit out on your own large balcony â€“ right on the Sydney Harbor â€“ drinking wine and eating Cheese and watching all the ships and boats. Each unit is a true luxury apartment with a full kitchen and separate living room. There is a Jacuzzi and a large separate shower. Our unit also had the Harbor view. The other side of the building has the Opera/Botanical Garden view Service is on the 5 star level with David Board (Chief Concierge) and his staff taking care of you. The best service was from Michael - a young gentleman/bellman/take care of everything needed - who is also attending college for his â€œHospitality Degreeâ€�. They really make you feel at home and that they do care about you. The only problem, during the stay, was a minor one at breakfast. We reviewed the big 5 hotels and I know we pick the right place to stay. P.S. I Visit the Chinese Garden of Friendship. If you are there on Saturday or Sunday â€“ walk through the street markets in the Rocks area. Watch the Saturday night fireworks over the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: annierocky
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in a one bedroom waterview apartment. Beautiful apartment with all the trimmings and spa. Easy access, lift opens on circular quay.......wake up to a view of a huge cruise ship on valentines day....lovely surprise. Opera house, cinema, bars, restaurants all within easy flat walking distance, great for less able patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemerc
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Quay Grand suites and absolutely loved it. Location is excellent & staff were extremely helpful & informative. We stayed in a one bedroom harbourview apartment, which was extremely roomy, clean & smartly decorated. For 3 people it was perfect with a KS bed in the main bedroom & a sofabed in the lounge. The kitchen was well equipped - not that you want to cook with the plentitude of restaurants that are tight on your doorstep. It was great to be able to sit on the balcony & watch the world go by, including the big passenger ships when they are in port. As soon as you close the balcony doors all noise is gone so perfect sleeping. I will definitely stay next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rose B
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, the view from our room and our balcony was fantastic, our room was very clean and the hotel was lovely and quiet. The location is perfect as you are right on Circular Quay amongst the eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best stay in Sydney CBD.”
Reviews.Author: TravAgent87
Reviews.Content: Ive stated at Quay Grand a number of times now. Each stay has been flawless. If you're looking for the best views, the best location, the best rooms (or suites in this instance), the best service AND the best value for money; in my opinion I'd say look no further. I've just finished yet another wondeful stay and wouldn't hesitate to return time again.

Reviews.Title: “Best View In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine39London
Reviews.Content: Had the most wonderful time at the Quay Grand Suites Sydney. Amazing location. We were there for 6 nights over NYE and had the most amazing view of the fireworks. We had a lower level room which was absolutely fine and there was plenty of space for ourselves and our 2 girls who slept very comfortably on the sofa bed in the lounge. Fabulous amenities, staff extremely friendly and helpful couldn't fault the hotel at all. Would love to return every year.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mollypoggle
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Quay Grand, unfortunately only for 1 night. Although our room was on the lower levels of the quay side, the room was very soundproof and the noise of the ferries did not bother us at all. The rooms are beautifully appointed and have everything you need, the Nespresso machine a nice touch. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. Already planning another stay there, this time for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline L
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Australia and we couldnt have chosen a more brilliant place to stay. Our balcony looked out at the Harbour Bridge and was central for everything. The apartment/suite was top notch, spotlessly clean, with excellent facilities. The staff went out of their way to attend to our every need. Would highly recommend this wonderful hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, luxury accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Vlada_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in Sydney and decided to sleepover in downtown. Quay Grande Suites were perfect choice. Suite is bit pricy, but you are in downtown: 3 minutes from Sydney Opera House, same from Royal Botanic Gardens and 10-min from Harbour Bridge. Suite was very specious, along with jacuzzi bath and balcony. My family liked the stay very much. Considering location this is perfect location to watch famous New Years Sydney fireworks. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a view.”
Reviews.Author: Scowie60
Reviews.Content: At $1100 a night this should be good and it is. Valet parking means you have to wait for your car and you pay for the parking even at this room rate. They also charge for Internet access - pretty mean at that rate. Rooms are very well designed to give a feel of a proper suite. Kitchen offers the self catering opportunity and a pull out double bed with a proper inner spring mattress means that extra person gets a good rest. Balcony is big enough to sit and savour the view. Walking distance to most of the major attractions in Sydney. Good quality fit out makes the price tag reasonable. This is essentially a self catering apartment with the service of a five star hotel in the heart of a great entertainment area and access to the famous Sydney ferries to go anywhere on the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel In a Fab City”
Reviews.Author: mountainman77
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate, the service efficient and the location is superb. Loved the hotel, loved this city.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location! Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: mssell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned for 4 nights at Quay Grand Suites. We have done a lot of travelling in the last 20 years but we think this hotel probably is the best, location-wise, we have ever stayed in. Our room was very clean, loved sitting on the balcony overlooking Cirqular Quay and the visiting mega-cruise liner was amazing. Loved having a little kitchen but with so many eateries so close by, we only used for the fridge. The staff were FABULOUS. Well done to Hugh on suggesting how we most efficiently use the hotel internet and being shown to our room was a very classy way of making you feel special upon arrival. We dined in the ECQ bar and loved it. Nothing like a lazy lunch watching the world go by. My only 'beef' would be why do amazing hotels such as this insist of charging for internet, movies etc? Compared to the room rate, it seems really penny pinching and splitting hairs. We didn't realise the movies were at extra cost. After going to get dessert and a bottle of wine and sitting down to watch it, we then had to agree to pay $15.95 for the joy of doing that. I have never ever paid so much for a room and then been charged extra for a little thing such as a comedy movie.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say is that the staff are fantastic. Absolutely fantastic. They are helpful, knowledgeable, and genuinely friendly. Second, and the thing that Quay Grand sells itself on, is the location. We were lucky enough to get a harbour view suite and we slept with the curtains open. What a view! If you're in the city for New Year's Eve as we were, there is no better place to watch the festivities. The rooms were very nicely appointed and very well looked after. The beds were fabulously comfortable and the zonal aircon meant we could keep the bedrooms slightly cooler than the living room. We travelled en-famille, so the washer, dryer, fridge and dishwasher were pressed into daily service. Minor snags and the reason it wasn't pure perfection: the TV's had recently been changed but the walls hadn't been properly repaired; the wifi was expensive (who makes their guests pay for wifi anymore?) and almost unusably slow; the chairs and sofas in the lounge weren't terrific. Worth every penny, though(apart from the wifi) and we'd return for the staff alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Redleather6
Reviews.Content: I asked for a high floor when booking and got the lowest. Had to change my keys 3 times. The door on the gym and pool was faulty the whole stay. Had to ask to get somebody to let me in each time I wanted to use it. Suggested they leave the door open or at least put a sign on it. Suggestion fell on deaf ears. Not so much as 'We are sorry'. Staff had couldn't care less attitude.

Reviews.Title: “The pick!”
Reviews.Author: ozikiwi
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and views! We have been to the ECQ bar on level 1 on many occassions where the Bar Manager is so helful and pleasant all the time. To stay at the hotel for a night was a treat! Great balcony, large kitchen, lounge and bedroom.(Harbour view). The cruise ships come and go regularly so you will probably see one across from your room in the early morning. Nice afternoon sun also. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: kxburnie
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay we stayed for two nights location brilliant great views looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate V
Reviews.Content: We spent our 10th Wedding Anniversary in a harbour view room at Quay Grand and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location with fabulous views. Excellent restaurants within walking distance. Staff were helpful and friendly and brought us up some champagne to celebrate our anniversary. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Views to Die For”
Reviews.Author: richardlizkt
Reviews.Content: Want to look out over Sydney harbour and the foreshore? This place is awesome. We particularly liked the bar on the 3rd floor, drinks were reasonable ($7 for a Corona) and the decor was brilliant. Spotlessly clean, very friendly unobtrusive staff, walking distance to everything. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay, ate fish and chips, had a ball. Went to Botanical Gardens (roses in bloom), walked through the city, total tourists. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great apartment!”
Reviews.Author: saml23
Reviews.Content: We planned a family holiday, (2 adults, 2 children), and wanted somewhere luxurious to stay in Sydney. I booked Quay Grand after reading reviews, speaking to the hotel on the phone and researching. Unfortunately, my husband and I were very disappointed. To start on a positive note, the actual location was fantastic, amazing views, (which you had to pay more for), but easy access to all of the main attractions and just perfect location wise. Also, the reception team and staff were helpful, friendly and very good, they made the stay much better. The other plus was the room service, it was good quality food and very nice. However, that's the end of the praise, and we were disappointed with our actual room and stay there. I was advised on the 'phone that a 1 bed apartment would be suitable for a family of 4 because the rooms were 'massive' and could easily sleep a baby in a travel cot plus a small child. The room was TINY, the whole apartment was. It made for a very claustrophobic stay. I wish I hadn't taken this advice and paid for extra rooms. Plus, the rooms were tired and old, not new and modern like I imagined. The washing machine was moudly and stank, the tumble drier didn't work after 20 minutes, and the kitchen utensils were not cleaned at all. The housekeeping was poor, and somedays nothing was even done in our room, and when it was done, it wasn't done very well. The rooms always felt dirty and certainly not anywhere near the luxury standard I expected. We were so disappointed with our stay there, (mainly due to the hygiene and standard of the room), and wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “second stay....”
Reviews.Author: Chappells
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and no complaints. We had booked harbour view â€“ view really only of the bridge but hardly a complaint! Loved hearing Sydney wake up each morning and loved watching it go to sleep at night. Staff excellent, we donâ€™t have a bad word to say!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Flimerimi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week up to Christmas. Loved the location, loved the view over Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge, loved the big rooms and loved the service. The whole team were amazingly helpful and attentive, nothing was too much trouble. We would unhesitating recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best location hard to leave”
Reviews.Author: Dave1965Perth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here 3 times now, The staff are always professional and friendly. The rooms are always beautifully presented and the new addition of a Nespresso machine was a pleasant surprise. We find the location perfect to explore sydney from and love our balcony which is great for sitting and watching the ferrys coming and going. We have stayed in several nice places but I suspect I will disapointed from now on if we dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: freddielola
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here 5 years ago and promised ourselves to try and stay again this time. We had three nights with a harbour view and loved it. Very spacious comfortable apartment with all amenities including laundry.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lkm995
Reviews.Content: First and foremost is this splendid location with a magnificent view of the circle quay, Sydney Harbour and the bridge. (We stayed here 6 nights). The location itself makes this stay totally worthwhile. The rooms are large, 70 sq m which is almost twice that of a 5 star hotel. The kitchenette is well equipped with refrigerator, coffee maker, washing and dryer, cups and saucer, all cutlery. The balcony is large with the perfect view of the Harbour. ( some rooms face the back and you need to specify). the decoration is very good. Jacuzzi comes in the bathroom as well. We have not tried the restaurants because everything is so near. The convenience of this hotel is truly the selling point. We can stay here for weeks, it is so comfortable and nourishing. Look no further, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location if you want to be on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Travelette4666
Reviews.Content: Great views from our spacious apartment. We stayed 7 nights and had very good service. Room service is very good and comes very quickly. Housekeeping does a good job and are friendly. David and Emma at the front desk are super at helping with whatever you might need - reservations, packages, spa set up, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend to attend a wedding at the Opera House. Staff were wonderful and somehow always available. Rooms were spacious, modern, clean and appealing. A surprisingly great location to be based while visiting Sydney. Harbour breeze is lovely on a warm day.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Gattaca616
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I stayed in a 2 bedroom harbour view suite for a week in the school holidays. It was our third stay here and it just keeps getting better. Why? Because we love the fact that it offers all hotel amenities and so much more. No cramped hotel room, no astronomic laundry fees and no uppity staff, but well appointed spacious rooms with the most fantastic views, a whole laundry included to use at your own convenience (important for longer stays) with no extra cost, and discreet personal service from the staff. if you don't want to cook, use room service. Bring your own CDs and DVDs, or get Movies on demand. It is all on hand. It is also close to some really good cafes and eateries, easy walking distance to the shops, and a stone's throw to major attractions. It is really great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ralph I
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a incredible stay at the Quay Grand Suites in Sydney. The hotel was over the top and we rate it 5 stars, view, rooms, location, service, food and facilities. When you go to Sydney you must stay at the Quay Grand Ralph I

Reviews.Title: “Old appliances, dirty room, roaches, + nice view”
Reviews.Author: Karis L
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights, harbour view room which was spacious for our family, had a great view, balcony, and it was indeed fun to look at all the ferries going back and forth. Our main complaint would be that the WASHER DRYER in our property was quite old. It rattled so loudly and we thought it might spin out of control and hurl itself out of the closet like a meteor, smelled (awful), and was always unbalanced despite all of our makeshift additions to prop it up... making laundry a hassle and unpleasant. It was also a Tiny, little machine which Stunk of mildew, AND it did not wash our clothes well. The regular cycle also took about 90 minutes, thats right folks, 90 minutes. Despite this the kids clothes still had their ice cream stains etc. As a parent looking to pay extra for the convenience of amenities like a washer and dryer while away on vacation, I would expect that these much touted appliances be in current and working order. Did we mention this to the hotel at the time? No. Why not? Because it was doubtful that they would, and we were not inclined, to have a new washing machine installed in our unit during our stay. We also had no desire to pack and move rooms and I suspect that all the rooms have similar model decrepit units, and if not, shame on Quay grand for not updating all the units. We also saw roaches in our kitchen which we read about before on other Tripadvisor reviews. We hoped this would not be the case but there they were taunting us. The hotel also charges for wifi which is irksome. To make matters worse the wifi is painfully, excruciatingly, horrifically slow-- rendering it useless. Staff were helpful in their cheerful Gday Aussie spirit way, no complaints. They could not get us a late check out though which was tough for our late night flight back to the US. Mattresses are feeling rather thin and worn out, and should likewise be updated. Housekeeping clearly did not vacuum daily, as there were crumbs still visible to me (we do love those Tim Tams...) all over the carpet daily. Dear management, this may have some link to the roach problem... I'm just saying... Overall, served our needs but not a great value in comparison to other serviced apartments we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay before my flight”
Reviews.Author: FunkyBeat
Reviews.Content: Qantas has delayed my flight, so I thought it would be nice to stay somewhere in the city. The service was fantastic from a very friendly and knowledgeable Rick. The Rooms are huge,clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, close to transport and restaurants. The view of the Sydney harbour is very impressive, however the noise of the city can be bit tiresome afterwhlie. Overall a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with a baby!”
Reviews.Author: CRokers
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location superb. Facilities appartment great. Enough space for relaxing. Good soundproof (but we had a gardenview appartment). We stayed here for 6 nights with our 6 months old baby. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for perfect views!”
Reviews.Author: Sydneybluefrog
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Quay Grand very much. Loved the Harbor view from the terrace! We were visiting Sydneysiders, so were very happy to be so close to the CityRail--so easy to get to the airport or to Bondi or south. Also great to be able to walk outside and see the iconic Opera House or get a ferry to Manly in seconds. Service was overall, very good. My only complaint is that the maid service came very late in the day both days and we were there when they were cleaning, despite asking for morning maid service. Otherwise, a great place to stay. Better than the photos, actually.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, you won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: crazyblonde_10
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for location, location, location than Quay Grand Suites is for you. Yes, its expensive, but you get what you pay for. Close to everything, including a slow stroll to the Opera House, Botanical Gardens and transport. Every emaginable eatery is at your fingertips so you can't go wrong. If you're not feeling like going out to eat the in-house restaurant is great and the bar has a view to die for. Hop on the train or bus to Pitt Street and shop girls until you drop. Sydney, for me the most beautiful city on earth.

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant end to our holiday - thanks to the Quay Grand..”
Reviews.Author: Tanya1000
Reviews.Content: I had read lots of reviews on Trip Advisor about how great the Quay Grand Suites were, with everyone raving about the Harbour view rooms. As our stay was going to be at the end of our big Australian trip and it was our 15th wedding anniversary, I decided to splash the cash and book a Harbour view room. I mentioned in our booking that as it was our anniversary and the booking was a surprise for my husband, I would really appreciate a room on a high floor to maximise the view. When we turned up at the hotel I was immediately impressed by the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The person who checked us in took us to our room and chatted away to us as if we were old friends. The hotel had noted my comments on the floor level and put us in a brilliant room (903 I think) on the 9th floor. We travel a lot for both pleasure and business so are guilty of being a bit jaded when it comes to hotel rooms and views but even my husband was stunned by the room and the view beyond the window once we got through the door. We loved the fact that it was a suite and it was very cleverly designed to make the most of the space. The furnishings were all in very good condition, the room was spotlessly clean and although the bathroom wasn't uber modern I wouldn't have called it outdated or old (and I am very fussy about my bathrooms). The piece de resistance was our balcony where we spent some very pleasant mornings and evenings watching the ferries come and go at Circular Quay and the sunset over the bridge. I thought the room was brilliant value given the view, the balcony and the proximity of the hotel to the key attractions i.e. the Opera house, Botanical gardens, Circular Quay etc. However what really set the hotel apart was the quality of the staff. Everyone we met and dealt with was unfailingly helpful and pleasant. Everyone seemed genuinely keen to make sure we had the best time possible in Sydney and at the hotel. And we were particularly touched when we got back to our room one afternoon to find a card from the hotel congratulating us on our anniversary. Someone had taken the time to note from my booking that it was our anniversary and then give us a card when we arrived. That level of service and detail is absolutely brilliant and really sets this hotel apart from some of the other (more expensive!) hotels we stayed in on this trip. Stay here and book a harbour view room. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Be part of the few lucky ones ; be GRAND at the QUAY GRAND, and pay accordingly”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: One room serviced appartment with the bridge view costs very expensive late september. Room only. At this price, we have every service from a hotel, such as room daily serviced and the privilege of being exactly where we have always dreamed to be in Sydney ; at both the opera house and the harbour bridge We like : -Canâ€™t beat the location. At least to those, like us, who can spend entire life watching the bridge or the opera house. Surely one of the nicest place to be on earth -Canâ€™t beat the view ; breathtaking over the harbour, all time busy with criscrossing ferries and happy people coming and going circular quay to the opera house -Large for 2, 40-45 m2 ? Fully equipped appartment, correctly furnished and warmly decorated, not really edge design but consensual modern touch. Wifi for as many laps as you want, washer and dryer, complete kitchen with dish wash. Notice : all window blinds are electric, yer sir -Individual balcony We donâ€™t : -Old style bathroom, but fully equipped and large Tips : -The bridge view gives this place its very particular privilege in Sydney, so the garden view rooms may cost less but the effort worths every penny, to be on this side

Reviews.Title: “A Stay I will Always Remember”
Reviews.Author: Ray C
Reviews.Content: From the minute we wlked through the door, early i might add, just to see if we could leave a bags there while we seen the sights od Sydney We were told our room was ready, no extra charge. Friendly, consideratre staff, the room was impeccable. I would refer this motel to anyone, and we have stayed at many.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_2206
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour View suite for just 1 night as we were travelling through Sydney. The suite was spacious, clean and had everything in it that you would need. Staff were friendly and helpful and very nicely dressed. We had room service for dinner which tasted fantastic and the prices were pretty much the same as any other hotel room service. Location is right next to the ferries and only a few short steps from the Opera House and eating venues. I would definitely stay here again and would always choose the Harbour View.

Reviews.Title: “only 2 room suite has view worth the money”
Reviews.Author: NationalHoliday
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed in a suite on the 9th floor. It was an unexpected stay. We were both travelling with assistance dogs and were invited guests of ABC Radio at an Opera House event. Yet the Opera House (which has its own legislation) refused us entry and it was drama. Quay Grand welcomed us and our dogs and easily accepted the documentation for the animals. All the staff were informed of our stay, so we never needed to explain our situation when taking the dogs out to toilet. This is very important. The suite is spacious and worth the $900 or so a night. The corner balcony with the best view is tiny, and the furniture gets in the way of the door, but you put up with it for the view. Also, there was no way to secure the door open to get the breeze, so we made up a DIY tie. It was a super-comfortable place to stay and recover for a few nights. At night, the view is just as good, so it's easy to stay up all night and just watch.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: plugga_syd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Harbour View Suite for two nights and were blown away by the view. The hotel itself is modern and very well appointed. The staff were friendly and on hand to answer any questions about the area. The concierge was efficient in every way. Very quiet even with ferries and trains only metres away. One must do is breakfast in the Quadrant Restaurant. Selection from menu and cooked to order. The only very minor issue is that there is no turn down service at night which I would expect from a hotel of this quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and views”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending a week at the Quay Grand suites. The check in was very smooth, friendly and effecient,we were escorted to our harbour view apartment and as everyone before has stated the view was breathtaking. The apartment itself was very chic and contempory in style. The lounge area had amazing views of the bridge and a separate dining area. The bedroom had views towards the city which was lovely when all lit up at night. The bed was extremly comfortable and the bed linen spotless. The bathroom had a spa bath and separate shower it was very clean, not overly luxurious but this is an apartment not a 5 star hotel room. The kitchen was fully equipped with a full size fridge, oven, microwave and small dishwasher. There was even a washing machine and dryer. It also had all the cutlery, glasswear and cookwear you would ever need. The room has double glazing so when the door to the balcony is closed it is very quiet. We walked every morning around through the Botanical gardens with spectacular views of the Opera House and Bridge. There are so many restaurants and other places to eat right on your doorstep and the Rocks area with it's pubs and markets or the city for shopping are within walking distance. A few pointers it did get quite hot in the apartment when the sun was shining in. There is an outdoor blind which is operated by a switch on the wall opposite the dining table it is a good idea to put it down on a hot day before you go out as this and the blinds keep the apartment cool for when you return. If it is very windy though the blind does automatically go back up which is quite amusing when it happens and no one is touching the swtch!.We did have an extra person for 2 nights and needed the sofa bed , this was made up with linen, pillows and a quilt and there was an extra blanket if required.All the staff were extremley helpful, even the cleaner asked if everything was to our satisfaction when we were going out which was very nice. We would definately recommend staying here, we stay in Sydney regularly and would definately return. Only one word of warning though you may never leave your balcony !!

Reviews.Title: “relax enjoy the veiws”
Reviews.Author: mossvale
Reviews.Content: such and easy drive down the m5 past the airport head towards the city enter the ed straight to the turn off to macquarie st park the car let the staff do the rest very friendly and helpfull rooms are very nice full kitchen the bathrooms have everything that you need spa bath for 2 is sooo relaxing the views from the lounge room and balcony are just the best the beds are very comfortable we went to the sydney fish markets to buy our seafood oysters,prawns,fish cooked in our kitchen and had it on the balcony with the great views

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing when paying 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: Deborina1
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that this aparthotel is in the most amazing location. Right on the harbour with the opera house only steps away. The bar has incredible views of the bridge & so, I am lead to believe, do the harbour view rooms. We stayed in a garden view room & the view was ok but we did not expect an amazing view so that was fine. The room was spacious & clean but in need of a bit of updating. However, there are more than a couple of niggles only because this place is not cheap at all. Firstly - I emailed the hotel a week or so before we left to explain arrival details - we were expecting to arrive at appx 10pm & thought it best to inform them. I got no reply so I emailed again - still no reply. There were no problems as it turns out but I still would have expected a reply. Next: There were 3 in our party - the extra person incurred quite a high surcharge which was ok - we knew that the 3rd person would be on a sofa bed, but - the bedding was awful. The sofa was made up with only a thin beige scratch blanket. I called housekeeping & asked for a duvet - I was told (abruptly in my opinion) that the hotel did not carry extra duvets. I appealed & explained that it would seem bad practice to leave one paid guest with innadequate bedding - she was quite cold & the blanket wadid not have a nice feel. the member of staff rudely repeated that they do not have extra duvets but said he would see what he could do. Nothing was heard from that request again. Next day we made the same enquiry at reception & were told that they could only send another blanket - which they did this time but now my friend simply had 2x scratchy blankets, hardly 5 star in service or quality. Shame. Also: the apartment was really only set up for 2 people - even though we had paid that high surcharge. 2 chairs on the balcony, 2 coffee sachets, 2 lots of toileteries... it seemed a little like that 3rd person wasn't all that welcome. Also, 1 afternoon we came back & found that my friends sofabed was only partly made up. there was abandoned pillows in the middle of the bed in a pile & no pillowcases on or left anywhere else. This was quickly rectified, but still??. Lastly: we stacked up the diswasher each day & turned it on but housekeeping only unloaded it once during our stay. We did enjoy our stay, the hotel has redeeming qualities & most of the staff were very helpful. But I don't think I would stay there again for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SLPExplorer
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay for eight nights overlooking the Botanic Gardens. Exceptional location. Meticulously clean and spacious rooms. Loved the wall of windows during the day, and the blackout curtains, quiet room and comfortable bed at night. Kitchen and laundry facilities were very helpful. Access to trains and ferries, and proximity to CBD were a huge benefit. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: rickie g
Reviews.Content: We spent our vacation and I was amazed at how well insulated the rooms were from the hustle and bustle of activity outside.The bathroom was beautiful with marble everywhere,Awesome service, great location, and extremely friendly. bedroom! also Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: gwgreen
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view, elegant rooms, great staff, fantastic restaurant...all the amenities. Best location! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quay Grand Suites Sydney - Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Quay Grand Suites Sydney for 5 days. There would be no better place in Sydney to Stay. Spectacular views overlooking Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour Bridge during the day and breathtaking at night. Walking distance to major touist attractions, ferries and train station a stones throw. Hop On/Hop Off bus a 2 minute walk with connections to Bondi. The rooms were clean and apartment style size, just wonderful. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful. Room service exceptional. Local quayside dining a great hub to watch the world go by with wonderful food choices. Swam in the pool and exercised in the gym, both great facilites. We climbed the bridge - A MUST for all travellers to Sydney. We WON'T stay anywhere else when we return, a wonderful "kids free" week with my husband make all the better by Quay Grand Suites and it's wonderful staff. Many Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Poolini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situation overlooking the circular quay ferry area and the harbour and has a good view of the bridge. It is a bit of a walk to the main sydney shopping area, but the hotel is centrally located where all forms of transport are easliy accessable. The rooms were clean and well laid out using the glass windows to show case the view.The room we had was equipped with a kitchen. We ate from the in house dining on 2 occassions, one was very ordinary and the other was great. Also went to sailors thai in the city which was ok and then to Catalina at Rose bay which was very good but expensive

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SophieGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: The location and comfort of this hotel makes it without a doubt the best place to stay in Sydney. We had a one bedroom harbour view suite for 3 nights. Panoramic view of the Harbour Bridge and overlooking Circular Quay. You need never leave your balcony to experience the pulse of Sydney. Sitting in the afternoon sun on the balcony watching the ferries come in out and people enjoying the foreshore, was extremely entertaining. Great location for walking/running around the Opera House,Botanical Gardens (note no access before 7am as gates locked) and under the bridge to Darling Harbour. 3 min to train so if you don't feel like walking up to the city you can catch a train in minutes. Very nice bar with panoramic views, live music and very good bar food. We will never stay anywhere else when we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Australia”
Reviews.Author: jays-paris
Reviews.Content: My partner and I come back to this hotel each summer and love it. We have a suite with a spectacular view over the harbour and just above the ferry terminal and it is sheer pleasure to sit on our balcony and watch the ships and ferries come and go on their daily chores. The hotel has a good restaurant but is also surrounded by other options outside; The service is impeccable and the staff all very friendly. Transport is superb as this hotel is in the centre of the city, but we usually keep a rental car in their carpark and we go most places by ferry. Perfect when in holiday mood. The rooms are fresh and clean and adequate with a small kitchenette which we seldom use. We highly recommend Quay Grand Suites for anyone holidaying or working in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “loved it and recommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: BostonQT
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 days in a harbour-front room, and found the views and location unbeatable -- can't imagine staying anywhere else now! Rooms are clean and comfortable, and service is friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: nick k
Reviews.Content: best view best room rest food best service best of everything

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Prebbletonite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on circular quay which makes it handy to all modes of transport and has fantastic views of the harbour and bridge or the gardens and the bays beyound. Check in was an experience all by itself, we felt like we had booked a pent house or such like. Although we had left our bags there early in the morning,when we arrived back for our key we were escorted to our room (1 bedroom suite #906) and were given a great run through of all the bells and whistles that our apartment had to offer. The suites are spacious, light and airy, The kitchen is more than you would ever need and caters for 4 people. The bathroom is well lit, well appointed and has a spa bath as well as a good sized walk in shower The bed was extremely comfortable and it was also great to lay in bed and watch the lights .There is also a good business desk and the wiFi was a good speed. There is an open plan living area with a table for 4 and a lounge where you can sit and watch the harbour and the bridge. All the amenities are there to make life easier. Our suite was spotless. Surprisingly the rooms are very quiet and we slept well. Breakfast was lovely and an al la cart menu, which was a nice change from the buffet style.The service staff were extremely attentive. This hotel is definately on our return list and we will definately stay at the Quay Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: mrswroth
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about our stay, service & room were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: aquablue21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quay Grand so we could attend the City to Surf. The staff were very friendly and helpful - so different from the impersonal large hotels. Our room had a view of the Botanic Gardens and was very spacious and clean. The location of this hotel is excellent with easy access to the city and the harbour and all its attractions. I only wish our stay was longer - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: someone40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Quays for two nights to have a look around Sydney and do the tourist bit. The rooms are a good size and have all the comforts of home. Lounge, dinning area, kitchen with washer,dryer and dishwasher so if you wanted to fix yourself some meals in, or needed to get some ironing done there would be no problem. The location is great, right opposite Ferries,trains terminal so just walk outside and you are on the Quays and just a few mins walk to the opera house. At the back of the hotel you have the Botanical gardens right on the door step. The balcony of the room overlooked the Ferry terminal with a clear view of the bridge so was just great to sit out and watch the world go by. It was my 50th birthday when we were there and i was given a card and had a bottle of sparkling deliverd to the room compliments of the hotel, that was very kind. All the staff there were really friendly and helpful and made for a great stay. I would recommend the Grand Quays.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Anne K
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I don't visit Sydney unless we can stay at the Quay Grand Suites. The location is unbeatable, the views are incredible, and the staff are super friendly and very accommodating. You can get to anywhere in the city by taxi, train, ferry or bus from right near the hotel. You can also easily walk around the Rocks, the Opera House, the Botanical Gardens, downtown, or across the Harbour Bridge. Or ... just sit on your balcony and be endlessly entertained. The suites are very comfortable and have everything you need, the food is great, the pool and gym are small but nice, and the price is fair for what you get. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and good location”
Reviews.Author: TheGreenFrog
Reviews.Content: This is a cross between a hotel and a serviced aprtment facility located on Circular Quay. We are a family of five and took two interconnecting suites. Each suite has a king-sized bed in a separate bedroom area, a sofabed in the living area, dining table, kitchen, utility room (washer/dryer) and bathroom. Each suite is quite large and with two interconnecting we had a huge amount of space. One side we looked out over curcular quay and the harbour bridge, the other looked out over the botanical gardens. Circular Quay is right next to the opera house and by the ferries so the location is great. The only quibble I would have on the rooms is that the showers are not powerful and do not hold a constant temperature. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and was fine but if you were paying separately I would think is overpriced for what it is. Staff were polite and efficient. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Viggle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our two children (3 and 5). We all absolutely loved this hotel. The very first experience was really positive with the lovely Rick showing us to our room. He really made it all very exciting for our children and he always chatted to them when we bumped into him around the hotel. The cleaner responsible for our room was also very friendly and obliging. The location is fantastic. We had a glorious view of the Harbour Bridge and we were a couple of strides from the ferry terminal. The room was just what we needed. Loads of space and the possibility of closing the bedroom off from the long at night. The facilities were really handy for a longer stay with children. The washing machine and kitchen proved very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Just go ahead and splurge and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ZenFinder
Reviews.Content: Ahhh--what else could I say that hasn't already been said about the Quay Grand Suites of Sydney?!?! I was able to book a room locking in a great last minute rate and I'm really glad I didn't let the higher price scare me off initially. I'm all for exploring the sights and sounds of a bustling city such as Sydney, but I've traveled here before and was absolutely beat after a strenuous adventure-tour in the more natural regions of the country. This part of our itinerary was supposed to be two days of "recharge" before we ventured off to New Zealand to start the adventure all over again. I think I slept more at Quay Grand Suites than I did the entire trip! Luxury is the word here. I love being pampered when I give a hotel my hard earned money and this is definitely the place to splurge. Go ahead and treat yourself to a stay here. If you're planning on being in your room for any given amount of time, it'll be worth every penny. Side note: SMALL gym facility, but one might be more motivated to relax and snooze instead of pump iron when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The best address in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: thedjlee
Reviews.Content: As a surprise birthday present, my wife had booked a two bedroom suite for our family of five. When she told me of the booking, I was unsure of its' location; but then amazed when we pulled up to the parking bay. Ever since these buildings near the Opera had been built (back in the 90's I think), I always considered this to be the premier address in all of Sydney. If I had managed to buy an apartment in the Bennelong complex, I could consider that I had "made it"! Well, this is the next best thing - renting a place for the night. At $500 a night, it is not budget. Consider the value of this: Two bedrooms; two bathrooms; kitchen; living and dining area; balcony; three tv's; and THE VIEW - Opera House in front, Harbour bridge to the left, Botanical Gardens to the right. World-class restaurants all within walking distance. What is this worth to you? For my birthday it was totally worth it. Concierge gave a free bottle of wine for my birthday as well. Parking is expensive - $45 a night; this is Sydney. Stay here for the essence of Sydney, at its' best address.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travel7310
Reviews.Content: Arriving on a wet day, it was great to be able to get undercover from the station. The reception was excellent and the room was superb with full wall glass windows with a view of the opera house. Very well equipped apartment allowed self catering but a good room service menu and many restaurants nearby Fantastic place to stay if you want to walk to the rocks and opera house and convenient for city transport

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Coastal_NC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 4 week cruise from Tahiti. We arrived very early, but they were most welcoming and had our room ready. The large suite was wonderful! The kitchen had everything one could possibly want or need during a stay. We ended up going to the grocery store to get some items for breakfast and snacks. The view of the Harbour Bridge was fantastic, especially at night. We couldn't see the Opera House, but who needs to when it's a mere 4 minute walk out of the lobby. In terms of location you are just steps to so many different shops, restaurants, the botanical gardens, as well as many other activities. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay while in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: CairnsMouse63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quay Grand Suites, Sydney for a one night getaway and was happily impressed with all the amenities and the friendly staff. Despite our room not being ready on arrival, we noted the staff tried hard to find another room for us. When one was not available we were offered a complimentary drink in the bar while waiting (which was most enjoyable considering the brilliant view). I especially liked being met at the door of the foyer when we first arrived and guest seating at reception was a nice touch. The staff certainly made us feel special. Our room overlooked the ferry terminal and out to the Sydney Harbour Bridge which was a sight to behold especially at night. The room was very nicely appointed, roomy and clean with nice little touches such as a personalised welcome message on the flat screen TV. Complimentary bathrobes, slippers and plenty of toiletries were supplied. Again, we were given an orientation of our room by a staff member including how to use the TV and stereo gizmo's,the automatic blinds (most rooms face westerly and the afternoon sun can be a bit much despite the view) and kitchen appliances. Bed was large and comfy, towels large and fluffy. I like the fact that this hotel is one of the few in Sydney that have a balcony and fully equipped kitchen that makes for a comfortable stay. At dinner time we cruised the large array of restaurants and eateries however being the day before Easter most places were full so we decided to return to the hotel and order room service which we ate on the balcony. Best decision we ever made - food was good, not too expensive considering the 5 star tag of the hotel and again the best view in Sydney. Room service was prompt and food was hot on arrival. Also, a little quiter than the crowded restaurants below us. We were surprised to note breakfast was served al a carte instead of the expected buffet style which topped off a very pleasant and memorable stay. In all the Quay Grand Suites may not be cheap but you certainly get what you pay for - 5 star all the way. We'll definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect introduction to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: adayal
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to explore the city, excellent and spacious apartments, lovely harbour views, and extremely pleasant, attentive and helpful staff. For a service apartment-type hotel QGS offers all of the basic facilities of a regular hotel while adding the convenineces you normally miss in those -- such as a fully equipped kitchen, washing machine / dryer etc. For anything more than 2-3 days, and certainly if you are with a family, it's an ideal place to stay. As a first-time visitor to Sydney we could not have made a better selection. If there is a downside to the excellent location is that...well, it's tourist central...so most of the restaurants and convenience stores in the immediate vicinity are over-priced. I know if I visit Sydney again thatthis is where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “One of the great spots to stay”
Reviews.Author: griswalds59
Reviews.Content: Loved the apartment style - plenty of room with fantastic views of the Harbour. Staff at the Hotel very attentive and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: goiabinha
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better: between circular quay and Macquarie street, nice views of the opera and the botanical garden. The two bedroom suite was really spacious and equipped with washer and dryer, full kitchen with dishwasher and three (!) TVs. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. There was absolutely nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Be part of Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: BrightShining
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway (2 nights). It was perfect! We had a top floor (10th) harbour view. We were low enough to feel part of passing parade from our balcony but high enough to enjoy the view of the busy ferry terminal, city sky line and harbour bridge. The full kitchen (dishwasher, stove and full fridge) made it possible for us to enjoy late breakfast/brunch just the way we like it. Great for anyone with special dietary needs. We didn't use room service or hotel restaurants (because we had other planned engagements). Because it is a suite we we happy to be in the room for breakfast etc and didn't feel cramped at all. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and on request gave us a late checkout on Sunday with the option of extending even further for a fee. We came by car (very easy to get to when coming from the north side) and used the valet parking which worked very well. Arriving at a busy time meant we had to park a little way down the street as the lay-by at the door will only accommodate approx 3 cars. The entrance was a little hard to see on the rainy evening when we arrived. The porter retrieved our luggage and our car was parked with no problem. Parking is in the same building so it was easy to retrieve some extra items after the car had been parked. Paolo the Porter, Sarah and Patrick on the desk all get big ticks from us! The room was obviously not new any more but was tastefully decorated and furnished, everything worked and was spotless and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s a comeback hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHMED_A_A
Reviews.Content: Specious room The view over the circular quay and Sydney bridge The location near the opera and the royal botanic garden Wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: Fermamss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel almost 1 week and 3 days,i say that,i really have a nice and excellent experience there.I love their own foods that they cooked for their Guest.They're have also a beautiful garden view.I like also the people who helping me.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, fantastic location and great staff..”
Reviews.Author: jubaanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, 3 nights in 1 bedroom harbour view suite on the 6th floor, and the last 2 nights (because our flights were cancelled due to the volcanic ash problems) in a 1 bedroom botanical gardens view suite, along with a complimentary bottle of wine, they looked after us well due to the emergency situation we faced. Right from the beginning the staff service could not have been better, they anticipated what we required (maps, suggestions for transport, sightseeing and dinner options), rooms comfortable and well serviced, handy to have a washing machine and dryer in the suite and full kitchen. The views were fabulous and make our holiday. Must do's .... Discovery or BridgeClimb, ferry to Manly for dinner, shopping in Balmain girls, lots of lovely bargains on beautiful clothes and Adriano Zumbo's pattisserie is there too for macarons and wonderful cakes. Walk the botanical gardens right next to the hotel. This hotel will not disappoint, worth spending the money for the location, views and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great all around place to stay for first time Sydney visitors!”
Reviews.Author: SafariGirl28
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Sydney and Quay Grand Suites was the perfect place to stay. First of all the staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant. I went with my mom and sister and none of us knew much about the city. The staff helped us with every question we had day or night and always had smiles on their faces. It made us feel so comfortable. Secondly, the location was perfect for tourists like ourselves. The first thing we did was walk outside the hotel and not 5 minutes later we were standing on the harbor walking up to the Opera House. It is the perfect location for tourists who want to see the sites and are not renting a car. Being in the Circle Quay area you have access to many shops and restaurants in walking distance and the trains, boats and taxis are nearby to take you everywhere else. Lastly, the rooms/suites are modern, clean and very spacious. We didn't use the full kitchen but if we had stayed longer we would have. Overall I would highly recommend staying here - especially if you are first time tourists - you can not go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: MicrobBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We could not fault any aspect of our stay at this hotel. Perfect location, close to everything. Fabulous views. Just like a home away from home. Staff were professional and knowledgeable. We had a corner suite, room 508 - very roomy. Sure, the suite could be fresher and updated but in the scheme of things, this was very minor. We were lucky to be staying while the Vivid Sydney Festival was on - the Opera House and other building were flooded with colour and music! Spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownRunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quay Grand for 5 nights. The location cant be faulted, 1 min from Opera house, great view of bridge and near all amenities. The apartment was well furnished and we had everything we needed. The downside would be the noise, if you like quiet this isnt the place for you. With any window open you have the sound of the ferries, trains and people below. We were on the 5th floor and if we stayed again i would definitely ask for higher. But thats a small gripe for what is the best location in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing destination!”
Reviews.Author: marisajh
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay, and only wished it could have been longer. We were in a harbour view suite with the balcony having the most amazing outlook over the Sydney harbour and bridge. Sat out there in heaven with bubbles and cheese - who needed to sight-see with a view like that! Fantastic location with everything within walking distance. Staff very friendly. Room was faultless with everything we could possibly need. Loved the large spa bath. Can't wait to go back asap..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: aussiefam5
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a 1 bedroom Botanical garden view suite. Lovely oulook from our room (913) over the gardens and we were pleasanlty surprised to be able to see the opera house as well. The service was efficient and friendly. No waiting when we checked in, all very smooth and easy. The room itself was clean and spacious. Decent tea and coffee making facilities with fresh milk provided also. Facilities included 2 tv's and 2 IPOD docks (one in bedroom and one in living area), comfy bed, iron, ironing board, safe, robes, hairdryer dishwasher, washing machine, dryer etc. The location is unbeatable with access to Circular Quay, Opera House, Botanic Gardens all at your doorstep. A shuttle bus to QVB runs every 10 mins from Circular Quay 9.30am which makes shopping a breeze too. Our previous stay was at the Four Seasons which was good, but we would definately choose to stay here again the next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Quay Grand the best for location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Dotlen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Quay Grand four times in the last two years. The location is unbeatable and the staff have always been extremely helpful. The apartments are luxurious, have every facility you could want, fantastic beds, and lovely view whether it be harbourside or Botanical Gardens. Some electrical things showing wear and tear, but when we had a problem it was immediately fixed. From airport to hotel by train is so easy- arrive 50 metres from the hotel and no worries about traffic. Being right on Circular Quay, the ferries are at your doorstep to take you anywhere. The Opera House is within 50 metres, and it is right on the Botanical Gardens. Just an unbelievable location and fully equipped facility. It is beyond my usual budget but with last minute deal prices I indulge myself- nothing else compares in my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star anymore”
Reviews.Author: WollongongCoconut
Reviews.Content: On our regular trips to Sydney we have almost always stayed at the Fraser Suites. In recent years, however, it has become a bit of a tradition to treat ouselves to a "5 Star" weekend at the Quay Grand for our anniversary. The hotel has everything a Sydney visitor could wish for, and the location is as good as it gets. Until now, we have thoroughly enjoyed our stays, and have had no hesitation in recommending the hotel to friends. This trip, however was dissapointing. The hotel has dropped markedly in standard and could not possibly continue to be regarded as "5 Star". The coffee mugs were cracked and stained, and the room was desperately in need of a good clean. The bathroom walls were stained and dirty and dust and grime was accumulating around the toilet floor. The Flat Screen TV screen in the living room was scratched and amost unviewable. No HD reception seemed to be available and I'm sure that even if it was, the TV would be incapable of showing it. If Mirvac management think they can justify a tariff of around $600 for the view alone, and completely disregard the most important features of their flagship property, they will surely need to find innovative excuses for the lowering of the hotel's occupancy rates. Not 5 Star anymore, Mirvac.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!! Nowhere better.”
Reviews.Author: Joneoliva
