Reviews.Content: My friend and me stayed at this hotel 3 nights in April,2011. Everything there is excellent, the location is very comfortable and the view is very nice. It is really modern hotel in Sydney. Our room is large and clean and is decorated beautifully, suitably. The staff are so friendly and helpful. All time we stayed there we felt comfortable. Breakfast is very delicious. We will come back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Place to Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Max357
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on countless times and still view it to be the best in Sydney. We regularily stayed here for the last 10 years and still believe it to be one of the best places to stay. It not only provides 5-star rooms, however, 5-star location and views. Once you stay here, you will be never want to stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “If this is the only time you'll visit Sydney, make it count and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: astroeliz
Reviews.Content: Our family (3 in our 30s and our mom) stayed in a two bedroom suite overlooking the harbor. We considered our trip to Australia a "once in a lifetime" opportunity. That mindset played in our decision to stay at this hotel. It's outrageously expensive... but if it's possibly the only time in your life to visit Sydney, make it count and stay here! Regarding the accommodations, the space was laid out well in the two bedroom/two bathroom corner apartment. The internet was free if you signed up for the "mirvac club" which was an unexpected bonus. I thought the balcony was a little small-- perfect for two people but crowded with three or four. The bathroom fixtures seemed a little dated but definitely tolerable. The view is amazing. The location is amazing. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Magsy9
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at Quay Grand and was not dissapointed. Our harbour view room was huge, modern & comfy. Every creature comfort was available in the room. Having a balcony to enjoy the view was great as we usually stay in hotel rooms around the quay. We could enjoy the harbour from our own luxury vantage point with a nice cold bubbly. The pool area is lovely with a open air lounge area to relax although we were happy to sit on our own balcony and get our moneys worth. Its definately a treat but well worth it. The staff were all fantastic and very friendly which is a plus. Will be saving our pennys for this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ipostini
Reviews.Content: We did quite a lot of research on hotels and even after all that, we still changed hotels after we arrived. We moved to the Quay Grand and were overjoyed. The staff was excellent. The location is incredible. We stayed on both the harbor view and the garden view. The garden view was beautiful. The location is unbeatable. Walk to dozens of fantastic restaurants with incredible harbor views, tours, oh, and the Opera house is right down the street... The rooms were spacious and immaculate. tastefully decorated and suited for couples and families. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow and more wow.”
Reviews.Author: Barrovian70
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others have not already. Incredible service, and not in an "in your face manner", incedrible rooms (who does not like having a full kitchen in their room), huge living room and big bedroom, incredible balcony, amazing service. View of the Harbor Bridge,1 minute walk to Opera House and Botanic Gardens. Plus you have a train and ferry service steps from your door. I would recommend ANYONE travelling to Sydney to stay their there.

Reviews.Title: “Quay Grand Suites: excellent option for luxury tourism in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBenevolo
Reviews.Content: The balcony view of the harbour is superb...great for sipping some Hunter Valley Semillon in the afternoon. The room is huge and very comfortable. Very friendly staff. Wonderful but highly caloric breakfast, recommend the eggs benedict with smoked salmon:). The location is fantastic...we walked to the Opera House for some classical music concerts and the back stage tour...gorgeous Botanical Gardens right next door, Circular Quay with ferries to all the major tourist destinations right in front of the hotel. Considered staying at the Hyatt but quite frankly you won't get a better combination of room, view, friendly service or location than the Quay Grand in Sydney at the US$500-700 rate. Only negative point was the room service: some cold dishes were served during our stay. However, the way they made up for this serving us a full four course dinner with wine at no charge at their Quadrant restaurant shows how much they care about their guests. They offer five star service without the pretentious stuffy ambience you will often find in other hotels of equivalent class.

Reviews.Title: “What Great Location and Great Room Facilities”
Reviews.Author: amitshekhicu
Reviews.Content: I love Quay grand suites Sydney hotel hospitality services and love the hotel location and room facilities I will say thanking you for the hotel management commission with the all hotels members. I am very happy to these accommodations. You know what was the facility in my room? I think you donâ€™t believe it. Great Sun rise view from my bed side window, high speed internet any time, land line basic phone, A/C, Business Meting Room, flat TV, opera house and the most important thing shopping complex railway station is established hotels nearest area.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and accomodation for Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Lesley-Win
Reviews.Content: We loved this property, for a variety of reasons: the location, the comfort level and the range of services provided...we saw a suite identical to the one we stayed in for sale at 1.6 million, and having the opportunity to stay in a self-contained luxury apartment added to the whole experience immeasurably! We initially thought that the harbour view was a bit pricey, but did not regret the splurge, and after travelling Oz for a month, found it to be very much in keeping with the prices around the country. The Opera house is a block away, and walking in the Botanical Gardens every morning was a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, mixed on rooms, fair service.”
Reviews.Author: blairs1335
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Australia and New Zealand we stayed at this hotel twice, before and after our stay on Kangaroo Island. Booked Habor view 1 bedroom suites for both stays. Our first stay for a few days was marginal. Hotel flubbed our prearranged airport transfer, and transfer sedan was a no show. Our room this stay was tired and neglected, needing some attention to say the least(room 603). Our second stay was was just an overnighter. Hotel/airport transfers were handled properly this time. Our room this time was fresh, clean, and bright(room 707). All in all: can't beat the balcony views of the ferry harbor. Location very good(ie: opera house, CBD, and ferry transportation). 4 star at best until all rooms are as nice as our 2nd stay room. Big plus in room washer/dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but fantastic location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: psboll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week with our two year old. Aim was to be close to everything, have good sleep, and have a seperate bedroom so we weren't forced to go to bed when our little girl did. We also paid the extra for daily breakfast - kids under 12 eat free. Location was fantastic. We had a room overlooking the parklands but were an elevator ride away from Circular Quay. With trains and ferries on our doorstep, not to mention the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, everything was so close. Unbeatable location without the noise. Bed was really comfortable and the rooms were spacy. The restaurants, bar and pool all have fabulous views of Circular Quay. Staff were helpful and friendly although perhaps service was a little short given the price and rating of the hotel. Definately not a cheap place to stay but for a week, the location and room made it well worth it. We'll probably stay there again next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property in a stunning location with simply the best views”
Reviews.Author: Margina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (which was definitely not long enough). From the moment I walked in the front door I was afforded nothing but the very best of everything. The staff at this hotel are the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come across. I was shown to my room on the 8th floor and updated on the facilities available. The view was superb and the room was huge with a verandah off the living room, king size comfy bed, spa bath, rainshower, fluffy bathrobes, slippers and plenty of large towels. The fridge was well stocked and everything inside the room was in prestine condition. I spent the entire time in my room and only ventured out to checkout. As a travel agent who travels the world I am quite critical when it comes to accommodation. Quay Grand Suites was simply superb and I could not fault it in anyway shape or form. This property really is a level above other 5 star hotels I have seen in the city and I would highly recommend it as a place to stay if you want to be spolit in absolute luxury. You won't find bettter.

Reviews.Title: “Like being docked in our own private yacht”
Reviews.Author: EUtravelgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quay Grand Suites twice; once for only one day when we were arriving in Sydney and needed a place to stay over until the next day when we left for Adelaide for a week. We had a botanical garden 1 BR suite which was lovely. We were able to store a few suitcases at the hotel for the week while we were away (a huge help which saved us on excess baggage fees). We returned the following week but this time sprang for the harbor view and I am so glad that we did. The views were absolutely incredible and maximized by floor to ceiling windows. There are views of the Sydney bridge and the city which are just as spectacular by day as they are at night. I slept with the curtains open all night just to be able to look at the lovely lights from our bed. We have enjoyed several cruises and we all agreed that sitting our our balcony on Circular Quay felt EXACTLY like being on our stateroom veranda when on a luxury cruise. Adding to the experience was our fully equipped kitchen so we were able to enjoy coffee in the morning and cocktails in the evening as well as meals when we were tired of eating out. A small note: potholders and a broiling pan would have been nice but to be fair I didn't even ask for these. I am sure that had I asked they would have provided this to me. There is a pool located on the 4th floor. It is indoors. The photos on the website are true to form for the most part but in my opinion the hotel actually looks better in person (usually the opposite is true). The location is perfect. It is right at the place where the ferries dock so you can get anywhere in minutes. The train station is also right there too. And many things in the city are within walking distance to the hotel including high end shopping, Hyde Park, the Museum of Sydney and the Rocks. I cannot think of a better location to stay, particularly if you have come to sight see. What really topped off our experience, however, were the staff. Adelaide at the front desk solved a few issues for us right off the bat with a smile--she was just lovely. The manager was sensitive and thoughtful on several occasions. And Clive, we love you and wish we could have invited you in for a beer but we knew you were on duty--thank you for thinking WAY out of the box when we requested an extra table for our balcony. Even though you were completely sold out that day you went and got us your own personal table from the boot of your car and brought it up for us so we'd have an extra spot to sit. Thank you so much! If we ever return to Sydney there is no question in my mind that we'd return to this hotel. Thanks to everyone who made our trip memorable and special. We will not forget you!

Reviews.Title: “great view although slightly utilitarian”
Reviews.Author: kate234
Reviews.Content: A Harbour View room is an absolute must, the views are amazing, even from the bedroom. Well stocked suites, though I would say the 2 bedroomed suite is somewhat small for 4 adults, the 2nd bedroom is quite claustrophobic. There is only a very small balcony which is also a disappointment and the lift system is quite complicated, particularly to get to the pool. The staff are very friendly and helpful, but the hotel is slightly utlilitatarian. There is no bar and the restaurant is a bit upmarket, particularly at breakfast. It's better to take breakfast out of the hotel. Superbly positioned with easy access to all the main sights and close to restaurants for evening meals. As brits we found Australia very expensive for food, so look at menus before venturing inside! This hotel is pleasant enough, nothing startling, apart from the view.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't imagine a better place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertgreen
Reviews.Content: This property is an apartment block right on the Sydney Harbour Waterfront. The individual apartments are privately owned, but the block is run on a full service basis by a management company as a hotel. The apartment itself was superb. Fully fitted kitchen, utility room dining and lounge area with floor to ceiling windows looking out over the harbour towards the bridge. Huge bedroom and bathroom with wet room section and Jacuzzi, the height of luxury. The view from the apartment, especially from the balcony was such that if you saw it in a brochure you would assume that it was a doctored photograph. On that particular day, as if there wasnâ€™t enough to look at, the cruiser â€œOrianaâ€� was docked on the other side of the harbour. The apartment was also only 200 yards from the Opera House. The service is first class and the staff are very eager to ensure that you enjoy your stay and proved very helpful re suggestions for trips and excursions. The Quay Grand Suites is absolutely faultless and I would urge anybody visiting Sydney to make this their accommodation choice. I promise that you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with great views- loved it”
Reviews.Author: ren200sydney
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here - it was close to so many Sydney attractions as well as close to all transport. We sat on the balcony for hours watching the ferries, harbour and passing tourists. Went to a couple of the restaurants at Circular Quay East which suited the casual dining we were after with great views. Little bit of a walk to main shopping but we could have caught a train or bus which is virtually straight outside. I's not a budget hotel but I thought it was worth paying a little extra for such a great location. The suite has a kitchen so we made our own breakfast each morning and ate on the balcony. My only complaint is that there was some work being carried out on the ferry wharf which was a bit noisy- not sure how long that is going to go on!

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: rexxdog
Reviews.Content: If you like the combination of high prices and low quality - this is a place for you! The lobby has the atmosphere of community hospital. The service is more like a Motel 6. The location is convenient, if you consider Time Square, NY, to be a great location. The rooms are of a nice size, but bathrooms and furniture are dated. The service is sparse to non-existent. Stay away at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagicFamily
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in reception we were impressed. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The suite was immaculate with everything provided for our comfort. This included a bath spa, a very comfy king bed and loads of space. The location of the hotel is perfect, we had a balcony with a good view onto Circular Quay including the harbour bridge, it was truly magical and at night when the harbour lit up it certainly continued to impress. Highly recommended to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Efficient & For Circular Key, Very Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: HapiTraveller57
Reviews.Content: New to TA, so will be brief. My partner & i stayed here to see the arrival of Jessica Watson in her li'lpink boat. Therefore i would have thought it to be a tad expensive as that part of town was extremely busy,and the city in general very busy. Booked a one bedroom apartment with views of the botanical gardens (apartments are either on the harbourbridge side or botanical gardens side). Could still see the opera house and the water, and to be fair the greenery of the gardens was a calming outlook. Watching the bats fly overhead at dusk was something special!....Apartments are well appointed with kitchens, laundry,dining area and lounge, a private balcony and a very comfortable king sizebed. And a great spa bath! Roomwas serviced quickly and to a high standard each day. The property is only a stones throw from the trains & ferrys and the CBD,making it a great spot from which to base yourself. We did not utilise the onsite restaurants or bar, but did get room service on two occasions, service was prompt & delivered still piping hot -a test most hotels will fail. And food delivered was of a high standard. Again very fairly priced for Sydney central!. Staff were very friendly & efficent. I Reccomend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: dave_jacqueline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as a special treat - we had an apartment overlooking the Botanical Gardens and within sight of the Opera House. The design of the apartment was the very best we have ever come across - spacious, interesting, good utilisable balcony, full kitchen, bedroom with a view of Sydney and well thought out bathroom. The staff could not have been more helpful and willing. The niggle areas for us were a $40 overnight parking fee, $20 for one days internet and a VISA fee of 1.5%. The apartment cost was such that I would have thought some of these could have been reduced or absorbed. Still I suppose they cater for those on business accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - the view is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: alexandra001
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing - views, service - staff are really helpful and friendly. Only criticism is room service - food didn't seem very fresh and was definately not hot. There is a kitchette so maybe buy your own food and cook.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel â€¦ mate!”
Reviews.Author: moreandmore2see
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location with great views and the ferry stations only a short distance away. The rooms are very nice and very quiet with a logical layout and a nice balcony overlooking the harbor. There is a washer and dryer in each suite which was quite handy for us mid-vacation. The staff was competent and helpful. If you join the hotelâ€™s â€œfrequent stayerâ€� program you get free internet and bottled water in your room.

Reviews.Title: “One negative... Air Con struggled to keep out the humidity!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rater1981
Reviews.Content: Overall assessment... Above expectations, amazing staff; Adelaide and Mark are down to earth no matter how much money you have. The view is to die for, rooms absolutely beautiful, cleanliness above expected, meal was yummolicious (bit pricey)... Only negative, air conditioner struggled to keep suite comfortable! Will definately stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jane949
Reviews.Content: What a terrific experience! I am a return guest and have been staying at the Quay Grand Suites three years in a row. I've been staying in a one bedroom on the harbor and have loved every moment. Each time, I've called room service and received really excellent service! The people on staff are very helpful and extremely pleasant! The location of the Quay Grand Suites could not be better as I am have been so close to the ferry wharves, the train station, taxis, and buses. My experience at the Quay Grand Suites has been sheer perfection in a gorgeous Sydney, Australia!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel4funRA
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful apartment style hotel. So roomy and comfortable and hard to beat the location. Right next to Circular Quay for all of your transportation needs. We had a fantastic time here in Sydney. I would love to come back here again and again. There is a grocery store within 5 minutes walk. So close to so many things to do. The Sydney Opera House is 5 minutes away. Lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. Do yourself a favor and stay at this wonderful property. We traveled on the ferries to Darling Harbour and Manly Beach. So easy. We also did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. What a view from the top. You should do it! Sydney is a beautiful city with so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: SandSKapolei
Reviews.Content: Out of 5 weeks we spent on the Eastern Coast of Australia, Sydney was our favorite, and the Grand Quay Suites was a big part of that experience. We loved being right on the Harbour, we loved watching all the ferry activity, we loved the vibrance and energy of the City, we loved being so close to the Sydney Bridge (yes, we did the Bridge Climb and would recommend that!) and the Opera House (we recommend taking the tour). The Grand Quay Suites is so located that much of the City opens up to you by foot. The Rocks, the restaurants, the Opera House, the Bridge, and of course the ferries will take you to the Zoo, Manly Beach, Bonzi Beach.......wherever. Then you can return to this beautiful apartment, have dinner out or decide to dine in with your full kitchen. In the morning, the same choices await. Prepare a nice breakfast in your kitchen, or order up a wonderful Australian brekky from room service! Having laundry facilities available was wonderful after 3 weeks of traveling. All-in-all, the Grand Quay is somewhere that we would return!

Reviews.Title: “Location and great service”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyTravelNow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 4 children in July in a two bedroom harbour view apartment. Check-in was friendly and efficient. Room was spacious and had everything we required. Kitchen and laundry facilities were very convenient with a family. Stunning view over the harbour, well worth paying extra for a harbourview room. Location was fantastic. The service from all staff was excellent. Our room was serviced daily and we were given extra towels when the maid noticed our large family. She checked that we were happy and if there was anything else we required. We tried the breakfast at the hotel which was low key and relaxing along with the million dollar view! Check-out was smooth and we were farewelled by all the surrounding staff. Although the tariff seems pricey, we found it very reasonable when comparing to other accommodation in the area. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, great location however............................”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: This property is in an amazing location and has great views. We were in a one bedroom harbour view room and it was spacious and well fitted out. The full sized refridgerator was a bonus and the washing and drying equipment a bonus. The fitout of this hotel and condition is more 4 star than 5. The airconditioning in the room was effective but noisy and the bed was just ok - certainly not up to Sheraton, Hyatt and Hilton standard. The room has windows that open, hoever given the location it is a bit noisy. The staff were excellent, friendly and quite relaxed. If not for the view I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most gorgeous view of Circular Quay and the Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Namadgi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here entirely on the basis of the Tripadvisor reviews. I suppose my expectations were a bit too high as the #1 status makes you think the place is out of this world and it's not that, it's just very very nice and definitely a great place to stay. Sat on the balcony for breakfast and watched the ferries come and go - priceless. Staff were really friendly and helpful on check-in and check-out. Husband was a little worried about the valet parking but all went well. Definitely plan to come back with kids next time as we were there for a concert and didn't spend as much time in the suite as we should have!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lili_Eu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with my partner on the top floor of Quay Grand Suites in Sydney with a stunning harbour view opposite Harbour bridge. The apartment has a very smart design, perfectly furnished, well equipped. The spa bath in the bathroom was an extra to the beautiful, perfectly clean bathroom. The kitchen is well equipped, well kept - even includes a cheese grater that hardly any kitchens in such apartments provide. The only nuisance was the iPod dock that was hard to make working and set up but finally could work it out too. The price is high but probably the best view in Sydney so for somebody with maybe no further opportunity to stay there ever definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely :)”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: We spent three perfect nights at the Quay Grand Suites. While the prices seem high at first, they're on par with other high-end Sydney hotels, and when we saw the room, we knew we'd made the right choice! We had a harbour-view room on the sixth floor; this was bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, and living room/den, plus an oversized private balcony. The kitchen is fully furnished with pots, pans, dishes, etc; go to the Fish Market one afternoon and pick out something nice then bring it back and cook it fresh to enjoy on the balcony. The views of Circular Quay from the balcony are breathtaking; you must go for the harbour view rooms here! Bed was quite comfortable but did transfer motion a little more than we'd hoped. Bathroom had a jacuzzi tub (but would have been more enjoyable with softer lighting in the bathroom). I was very surprised at how well the room is sound-proofed; we did hear boat horns, especially in the mornings, but they were not annoying, just background noise. We didn't hear any of the street performers or crowds on the Quay, which was very nice, and even better, when returning to our room one night, we could hear the young kids in the next room shreiking as we passed the room in the hallway, but once inside our room, it was silent. There are a ton of dining and drinking choices right outside the doorstep--- walk a block or two away from the Quay to find some choices in a more affordable price range (try MOS Cafe up at the Museum of Sydney, or the little Indian restaurant around the corner from the hotel). You also have very easy access to all tourist spots via ferry, bus or rail just outside, and it's about a 10-minute walk to The Rocks. There is an Italian restaurant in the hotel and the hallways are always strongly smelling of baking pizza, which would be annoying except for the fact that it doesn't seem to travel into the rooms, just the halls. Service is friendly and the hotel is spotless. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JandD2010
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at the Quay Grand in Circular Quay. What a wonderful place it was. All my requests at time of booking, were followed through by the hotel. The service was excellent, from front desk, to room service. The rooms were very well laid out, comfortable, had everything we wanted and needed. Had a swim, nice pool and spa, used the small gym too. Fantastic location and views. Had a good breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel. Food was great, but only criticism was the service was was very slow at breakfast time, having said that we were in no particular hurry. Overall, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No better view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: aldavril
Reviews.Content: Well the Quay Grand never disappoints. We have been staying there for a number of years (when we can get a good priced deal). The view spectacular, so close to everything, circular quay for a ferry to anywhere, fine shopping within walking distance. Bars and eateries everywhere around the harbour. The service at checking in is very efficient. Suites have everything you could want or need. Only minor criticism is the lack of a porter when you first arrive. it has happened on many an occasion we have had to load or drag our own luggage to reception. Maybe a porter should be available at the door like most 5 star establishments. But will definitely be back. We love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Big 50 Blow Out”
Reviews.Author: nzlynn
Reviews.Content: This was a "big deal" choice for a "big deal". It was my 50th and we travelled from NZ to share it with my long time friend also celebrating her 50th. The Grand Quay Suites was the perfect choice for the weekend. We booked a 2 bdrm suite and had all the room we needed to host a small party for friends in the BEST location in Sydney. Faultless really, and SO good with a teenage daughter. Really need to go back for a longer than 2 night stay to really appreciate, but given the price tag really need another "big deal" reason....splash out and enjoy here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately one of the top hotels in Sydney, the service was excellent, the apartment was vey large, clean, beautifully appointed, beautiful views with everything you could possibly need. I have stayed in some of sydneys best hotels and this is definately up there if not at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway.”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: The Quay Grand Suites was our accomadation recently for 3 nights. We just couldnt find fault with our stay there. Spotlessly clean with attentive staff quick to respond to our requests. The central location cant be beaten with ferries and 5 star restaruants at the doorstep. Stunning harbour views really do take your breath away particularly at dusk when the city lights up. We will definately be back making this our special place to stay when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Quay Grand”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneEmma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon. The apartment was lovely, it was definately worth the money for the harbour facing view. Bathroom was large as was the spa in it. Best location in Sydney with the fantastic views and proximity to all the restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful. Ordered room service once, it was quite nice. I can't think of anyn issues with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and experience - exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: kochusan
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel experience. The location is perfect on the Circular Quay and only a few hundred meters from the Opera House, botanical gardens and ferries. The hotel staff is accommodating and attentive. The room was very clean and had a washer, dryer and furnished kitchen. We were within walking distance of just about everything including great restaurants in "The Rocks" and the Sydney Harbour Bridge (we climbed it). Be sure to get a harbour view room so you can watch the ferries come and go and see the sun set. We're planning a return trip soon. We really couldn't find much to gripe about. I suppose the bedroom could have been a little larger... and as usual Internet was a ripoff... Just go find a convenience store just south of Circular Quay and have all the Internet you want for $4/hour, no sense paying $19.95 for 30 MB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great amenities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Dotlen
Reviews.Content: Had a superb three day stay at the Quay Grand. Weather was crappy, but because of the location and the fantastic amenities of the Quay Grand, my stay was fantastic. First, location, location, location. Situated on the fantastic Sydney Harbour, it was a one minute walk to the ferries, two minutes to the Opera House, five minutes to The Rocks, situated on the Botanic Gardens, views of the Harbour Bridge, train link station to airport 500 metres (fifteen minutes from hotel to domestic airport). Second, the apartment was fantastic. Five star. The staff were extremely helpful. I did have a couple of malfunctions -someone was there within fifteen minutes. Value for money could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling004
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only has the most amazing location but also surrounds you in luxury. The rooms are very well furnished and the view from the balcony is fantastic - definitely pay for the harbour view - it is priceless. Overall an excellent hotel - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBunny
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at Quay Grand for 4 days. The location is perfect, we had an apartment facing the Botanical Gardens with the Opera House on the left. The apartment is spacious, with tasteful furniture. It was maintained spotlessly throughout the stay. A short walk from the hotel gives you access to the wharf where all the ferries leave from. The bus terminus and train station is on the doorstep. We climbed the bridge at Twilight and this was a highlight of the trip. A visit to China Doll on Wooloomooloo Wharf is a must for their pork belly. If we ever returned to Sydney we would stay here again. The South African staff made us very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation at superb location”
Reviews.Author: piperdoon
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our four-night stay. Location is almost unbeatable, and our room overlooked the harbor. We were at the end nearer the quay and train station, which was a minor drawback due to the occasional train or ferry horn, butm, then again, it sort of added to the authenticity of the location. Service of the room was exceptional. Restaurant and desk service was okay. Breakfast cuisine excellent. Pool is smallish and indoor, but lovely, with another great view. Suite was roomy, with all conveniences for a longer stay. With the location, the price is relatively good - still steep but very much worth the premium. Why Australian hotels all seem to charge for "broadband" (read: slow) connectivity is a mystery. Defintely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book if you actually need the room - They don't honour bookings!”
Reviews.Author: Ambers_view
Reviews.Content: I booked a $600 hotel room the Quay Grand via Wotif on Sunday 21 March via the wotif.com site to stay for our first annivesary on 27 March. It took them over 4 days to let Wotif know they had actually overbooked the hotel so I wasn't told until late Thursday that they weren't able to honour the booking by which time most upmarket hotels were booked out. Wotif did their best to resolve the matter asking Quay to find an appropriate alternative but all they came back with was a room at their lesser sister hotel, Quay West. When I said this wasn't appropriate, they refused to budge so Wotif luckily got me into the Sheraton on the Park instead. I'll never stay at Quay again and would not recommend anyone book there if they have a special event as there is no assurance you will get in and they won't tell you until pretty much everything else is booked out. Terrible terrible terrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel right on the Quay!”
Reviews.Author: MZ15U
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney for one day, and had an AMAZING stay at the Quay Grand Suites Sydney! The views of the harbor, the harbor bridge, and the Opera House were stunning! This is probably the best location in Sydney, as there are many restaurants on Circular Quay, and it is a probably 5-minute walk to the Opera House. Everything is right there! The quay is kept very very clean, and the restaurants are spectacular. The service was good too. All the receptionists were very friendly and helpful, and helped us book a tour in the nearby Blue Mountains. The whole decor of the hotel was modern, and with the beautiful white marble, and clear glass, it was a great place to be. The hotel is not large, so don't expect some mega-resort, but it a gem in the heart of the big city. Our room was very clean, very spacious, and very well-decorated. With two balconies, we had a view of the Opera House, and of the Royal Botanic Gardens which were both very pleasing. I don't believe there is a room in the hotel without a great view. We had two bedrooms, a living room, and a kitchen which all served us very well. Also located in the hotel a beautiful indoor pool, encased in glass, with views of the harbor and the harbor bridge. It is luxurious, modern, and simply gorgeous! So, if you are visiting Sydney, this is where you must stay! I could not have had a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “For a memory that lingers long after the vactaion is over!”
Reviews.Author: Rogocop
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Be sure you request a harbor view room (more expensive but oh, so worth it). Furnishings are 1st class and include a full kitchen and washer dryer. Balcony overlooks Circular Quay and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Convenient to the Rocks, Kings Cross and all forms of public transportation. If you're looking for a romantic place to stay, with killer views - look no further. Worth every penny we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: manasicaje
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong here ... the location is beautful, the rooms are great and the service is terrific. I can't honestly think of a bad thing to say. Sure it's pricey ... but you usually get what you pay for! Regarding the view ... we had an absoutely perfect view of the harbour bridge, but seeing the Opera House required some neck craning from the balcony ... if you're familiar with the location this might seem obvious, but thought I should mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisw1980
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney with my Mum, Dad and 87 year old Grandma and stayed in the Quay Grand for 8 days. We had booked a 2 roomed appartment but got two interconnecting one bedroom appartments. They were fantastic, one one side views of Darling Harbour with the bridge and the other was the Botanic Gardens with the Opera House. Can say anything bad, staff were fantastic particularly Rick the concierge with everywhere cleaned to a very high standard everyday. Would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone. Even if you dont go out you can sit and admire the views of the city sites.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: P_Newman99
Reviews.Content: good: excellent location near opera house, the Rocks, circular quay spacious quiet (at least in rooms that face the park) wonderful views (of park or of harbour) great breakfast bad: pool is indoor (but elegant)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Empireboy
Reviews.Content: This is part of the Mirvac Group and I have used their serviced suites many times before - however, I had never been to The Quay Grand. Things didn't start well. We arrived on an early flight and I had taken the trouble to e mail the hotel a few days before to request an early check-in and ask for some flowers to be organised for the room. I didn't receive any reply. When we arrived the receptionist (an early 30's man) quickly told us that they were fully booked and that there was no chance of an early check in. Though disappointed, I accepted that they were under no obligation to help as the official check-in wasn't until the afternoon, but his somewhat arrogant attitude was unfortunate. However, five minutes later, whilst still completing the forms he'd given us, he suddenly announced that he'd managed to re-organise things and was able to get us a room immediately. We were then shown to our room which, lo and behold, had the flowers sitting in a vase that I'd requested! It became obvious that, when we'd arrived, he hadn't checked his booking system and, on discovering his mistake, rather than come clean he'd suggested he'd done us a massive favour. Having said that, the room was good, the view spectacular (down on to Circular Quay and across to the bridge) and the location perfect. The service from the other members of staff was flawless. The only slight frustration was the internet connection was poor - very slow by International standards and, to add insult to injury, expensive. There is a reasonable indoor pool there and a small (very small) gym.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic except for the cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Carmate
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review as I have noticed a few others mentioning the cockroaches. Everything about this hotel is fantastic but it does have a cockroach problem. We have stayed twice about a month apart. It was because we loved it so much that we went back for my husbands 50th. The first time we never saw a cockroach but the second time they were all over the apartment. It really freaked me out as they are big. I couldn't sleep properly at night as I was worried about them crawling on me. Although housekeeping came and sprayed this did not get them under control and we went and brought our own cockroach spray which we used everywhere. After that every morning when we got up there were dead ones lying all over the floor. When we mentioned it to the guy on the desk he said that was just Sydney but I have never encountered this problem in any other hotel or apartment we have stayed in. Because of this I feel I cannot go back until they get this under control. It is unfortunate because the location etc is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice view but a roach infested room”
Reviews.Author: Rich1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quay Grand twice during January (2 nights and 4 nights). The first stay was quite nice - the room layout is great, views are stunning and you have your own kitchenette. The second stay, however, was not nearly as good. Normally we slept in late but the morning we were leaving, I got up early and discovered over a dozen large cockroaches (3cm and longer) in the bedroom, bathroom - on the walls, shower, toiletries, etc. due to the early hour. Not a pleasant surprise. We told the hotel management and they took $50 off our $2500 bill. I was willing to leave it at that but then at the airport a large cockroach dropped out of my coat where it had been hitching a ride. Just not a pleasant way to end a vacation having to unpack/isolate all luggage to ensure no cockroaches travelled back with us. Compounding this was the fact that the hotel sent us a web form to provide feedback. I provided the same feedback that is in this review and received back a form letter with a noreply address. Considering the price of the hotel (and the fact that I spent over $4000 with them in Jan) and the severity of the infestation, I was disappointed with their response. Note that the infested room number was 505.

Reviews.Title: “You really couldn't have a better location in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: superwrong
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a location! We booked a harbour view suite, and the view was just stunning -over circular quay and the harbour bridge. The room itself is very spacious, a large kitchen with all the appliances you could need, including a washer/dryer and microwave. There's a dining area with a table to seat 4, a lounge with flat screen TV and a double bedroom. The bathroom is large with a large shower and corner jet bath. Towels were changed everyday and the maid service was discreet and very good -they even emptied the dishwasher! If you exit out of the front of the hotel onto Macquarie street, turn left and you have a view of the opera house (1 minute walk to the steps of) and across the street you have the Botanic gardens, a great place to view the opera house and bridge and lovely for a picnic (look out for the fruit bats -an awesome sight!). If you exit out of the back of the hotel, you are on circular quay and can catch ferries to all over Sydney, including the beaches at Manly. There are lots of restaurants to choose from on the Quay, and you're just a 5 minute walk from the historic 'rocks' area with more bars and restaurants. Because you'll have the ability to make your own food, you must check out the food hall at David Jones, which is about a 20 minute walk away in the heart of the shopping district. It has been modelled on the foodhall at Harrods and you can buy anything here! We didn't discover this place until we had left Quay Grand and were staying in a hotel on Darling Harbour, but if we visit QGS again we'll definitely stock up at David Jones! The suites also offer room service if you can't be bothered to cook. One tip if you're a light sleeper -take ear plugs. The ferries are quite noisy and run from very early morning to very late night -be warned! My only disappointment really was that, given the high room rate, I would have expected free wifi. It wasn't and cost around AUS$20 per hour. In summary, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend QGS to someone looking for excellent accommodation with the freedom of self catering right in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bella008
Reviews.Content: We booked the Quay Grand Suites for 5 nights after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor and we couldn't have made a better choice. Arriving in Sydney at 6am after our flight from the UK we were through the airport and at the hotel by 7am. We did not expect our apartment to be ready at this early hour but we were delighted to be taken to it straight away. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The apartments are large and spotlessly clean. We had a harbour view which was magnificent. Having daily maid service and the use of a kitchen meant that we had the best of both worlds of a hotel and staying in an apartment Its location was ideal , being next to both the Opera House and the ferry terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - greta location and piece of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Maddysw
Reviews.Content: You wont be disappointed witht e location of the accommodation. Everything you want is on hand nearby. Furnishings were top notch, great bed and views to die for! Good pool and gym too , well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cowdenbeath50
Reviews.Content: We chose these suites at the last minute ( an I mean the last minute) after our other accommodation in Sydney turned out to be a disaster (which will be discussed in another review) The suites were fantastic, everything you would hope for, very central, great views and excellent service. I would not hesitate to recommend this accommodation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: davidnw
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in most of the luxury hotels in Sydney over the past 20 years i was delighted to discover Quay Grand Suites, which is undoubtedly the best hotel in Sydney. (Better than the Hyatt and half the price!). Delightful staff, excelent suites which are in effect full apartments with great kitchen, bathroom, balcony, living room and everything one could want in the most ideal location next to the ferries, close to the shops and all the other fantastic entertainment to be found in Sydney. Justifyable rated the best in Sydney by Tripadvisor. Great views over the park or the Harbour but preferably at a higher level due to possible noise at lower levels.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you TripAdvisors - We felt like Millionaires for the week.”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsTravellers
Reviews.Content: This has to be the easiest review I have ever written - don't bother researching any other hotel this is THE place to be. With quite the most amazing views, the balcolny is just the job to spend an hour or two people watching in such a stunning location overlooking the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Yes it is expensive, yes I did question myself whether it would really be worth it as the cost is a lot more than we normally pay however I am so very grateful to all the TripAdvisors who took time out to place this apartment at the very top where it deserves to be. My one recommendation is to say make sure you pay the extra premium for the harbour view. Sincere thanks to the the uber professional David on reception (are you related to David Walliams?!) . I can't find the words to express how truly special our stay was other than to say, this is the most memorable city accommodation we have ever stayed in, ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quay Grand Suites - Why stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Anon404
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Quay Grand Suites in Sydney for nine nights was just perfect. The suite accommodations are ideal providing extra space and amenities. The view and location is unmatched (excluding the view you have from the Park Hyatt of the Opera House). And most importantly, the service from the staff at the Quay Grand Suites was superb. All staff members we encountered were naturally welcoming, warm and friendly while remaining professional and eager to accommodate and assist to enhance our experience while with them. We stayed three nights at the Park Hyatt just across Circular Quay upon returning from diving the Great Barrier Reef. The location does provide marvelous views of the Opera House. The hotel is filled with sheik guests and those not staying at the hotel that want to experience the Harbor Bar and Kitchen. The room was lovely, and bathroom very nice. The service too was good, but a bit stiff and not nearly as warm and welcoming as the service received at the Quay Grand Suites. If we had it all to do over again, we would most certainly have returned to the Quay Grand Suites for our final three nights in Sydney. Don't consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Got to be one of the best spots in Sydney..”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie72
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching the best place to stay (within budget) - and think I may have found it! Incredible location - great views - perfect for the train station, water taxis, walking - amazing restaurants on your doorstep - and a great apartment to go back to every night! Hope to go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Superb facilities”
Reviews.Author: emuhawk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay and can highly recommend The Quay Grand for comfort, views and style. The Suites are in an amazing position in relation to walking distance to the wharfs and restaurants and the almost soundproof glass in the rooms means that even when Circular Quay is at it's busiest and loudest, close the balcony door and you could almost hear a pin drop. The bath robes, sheets and towels were of a very high standard as was the room service. The design of the rooms is as good as we've ever seen and the facilites very good. There was the odd cockroach however wandering through the place but not to be an issue. We did ask for a higher balcony if one was available and were surprised at being allocated the lowest one they have (the hotel did not seem busy) and wondered if this had anything to do with booking online through Wotif?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Appartment!”
Reviews.Author: thecat777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Grand Quay for the third leg of our honeymoon and chose it primarily because of the great reviews on this website. We were not disappointed. The service was great, the appartment lovely in terms of space, design and qualifty of furnishings, location wise it couldn't be more perfect for ferries, buses and trains. We had a harbour view room with picture perfect views of the harbour bridge. We would definitely stay here again if we returned to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: penickd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Quay Grand Suites for five days last week, and it was the best experience we could have hoped for. Two adults and two kids (ages 5 and 7) in a one bedroom with convertible sofa, kitchen, laundry, etc. The location was perfect (near the trains and ferries), and the view of the harbor was spectacular. More than just a room with a view, this hotel has a gracious and helpful staff who are willing to assist with everything from affordable dinner choices to the best activities for kids. One guy in particular (Blake, I think) saved the day for my kids by helping us get an Aussie version of a DS power adapter. You definitely get what you pay for here, and I would recommend this hotel to the highest degree for anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Needs Renovated - Still Great!”
Reviews.Author: coolbreezesd
Reviews.Content: Hi. My partner and I just returned from a six night stay at the Grand Suites at Circular Quay. We stayed at this great hotel based solely on the recommendations off of this site. We were not disappointed. The location is simply the best! It was great to be able to jump on a ferry, train, bus within moments. The hotel (more like a condo hotel - as they are all suites with washer/dryers, I believe) was terrific for walking adventures to "The Rocks", Opera House, Botanical Gardens and much more. The staff was great. The room was clean and ready for arrival. We were very impressed with how large the room was, with living/dining combo area, kitchen, with washer and dryer. We paid extra for a view towards the ferries and bridge, it was worth it! Here is my advice, ask for a room further towards the Opera House (further north in the building, away from city), the reason is that the exhaust fumes from the ferries tended to blow towards our room as our room was closer to the city (nothing to do with the city) if our room was closer to the Opera House side of the hotel, it wouldn't have been a problem. It was great to wake up every day and watch the water, and all the activity of the ferries and visitors. My only reason for not giving it a 5 star is that a 5 star hotel is that a 5 star hotel is the top of the top (St. Regis/Four Season) type room design quality. The rooms here are basic but good. So it get's 4 starts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: happyhels
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 and a half weeks in Australia staying in various hotels and this was simply the best! Expensive but so worth it! The service was perfect, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. If you can afford it, stay here, you wont regret your decision!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: FunInCali
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Australia. This hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern. We asked for some foam pillows and we had them delivered promptly. We had a garden view room and were very happy with it. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. Step outside to ferries, restaurants, the botanical gardens and the opera house. It is a short walk to the rocks and the bridge. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for place to stay in Circular Quay. The washer/dryer in the room sure was helpful. One thing we never quite figured out. They have a little business center computer. The first two days of our trip, we were able to use the internet for free. The last day we were charged $5 for 15 minutes. So maybe the first two days were unintentional.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAmm
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful, gorgeous views form our harbourview room, wonderful staff, lush room wih jacuzzi bath!! Couldn't find a fault highly recommend to anyone wanting a great location!

Reviews.Title: “As Close To 5 Stars As You Can Get....”
Reviews.Author: Ray_Rose_SpringTexas
Reviews.Content: Well if you're the ultimate snob and are prone to being super picky then you just might find something wrong with the Quay Grand Suites in Sydney. Step out the ground floor and you're at Circular quay where you can catch all of the feries, buses, trains, etc for Sydney. A 2 to 3 minute walk and you're in the rocks. If you stay on the garden side you can almost touch the opera house from your balcony. And since we're talking about the garden side of the hotel, the harbour side is nice, seeing the bridge and the boats coming and going, but haveing the Royal Botanical Garden on the opposite side is not a bad view either and it comes with the opera house view ..so if you want to spne the extra $100.00 per day for the harbour side fine, but we enjoyed the garden side just as well. I dont think the staff at the Quay Grand has the word no in their vocabulary. While they do not have unlimited internet access anyone can use the computer at the business station for whatever they need to acomplish without charge...you just cant tie it up for needless hours just surfing. My hats off to Chloe and Mitchel on staff at the Quay and all the other staff members who helped make our 11 days in Sydney a dream. One day we came back to find the room had not been made a call to housekeeping had the maid at the door semingly before we hung up the phone. Hilton, Four Seasons, Hyatt, etc, have your people network with the Quay staff to truly understand the meaning of customer service and more importantly how to implement it. I dont think you can ever rate anybody or any service as perfect...but like the LEXUS motto I think the Quay Grand is in relentless prusit of it. There are many fine Hotels in Sydney and some no doubt just as nice or maybe better as the Quay grand... you may even end up 2nd quessing yourself, but i dont think anyone will be upset if their time in Sydney is spent at the Quay Grand Suites. Ray & Rose Johnson Spring ,Texas

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO BE!”
Reviews.Author: ntegra
Reviews.Content: If I ever go to Sydney again we will be staying here! It was awesome! best ever location right on circular quay.... It is expensive but worth the money $!

Reviews.Title: “The one and only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gfox7
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review: We decided to go to Sydney for this years big family adventure (June 8-17). Wow. Sydney is everything. Jaw dropping, amazing, incredible (just one point - if you suffer from vertigo like I do then be careful. Sydney is very San Francisco like. One moment you may be on level ground, the next moment you are encountering a steep angle which may give you a serious spin/ headache - however still not enough of a reason to not be there!) We went in winter which was absolutely beautiful and Sydney had a festival on where one of the highlights was the Opera house illuminated with different colours and designs!. The days were still mostly warm and the nights were chilly - perfect because the whole City was so inviting. We decided to go for the Quay Grand Suites because we got a great deal on Expedia. It was the best decision that we have made. I could describe to you our check in and check out but I won't. The only thing I have to say is that Mark and Dave the two gentleman that were at front desk are the two most professional people I have ever met. They were cheerful, insightful and best of all they were good for a laugh. I have never known two people to light up a front desk like those two did. For that alone, Quay Grand Suites is a must. You will not regret it. And by the way their advice is second to none. Not only are they well versed in extensive knowledge but they know things! The room itself was perfect. It was huge and it was perfect for a family of three. My son of four had the sofa bed which was just fine for him. The bed itself was seriously comfortable and the added bonus of a kitchen/utility area was welcome. The bathroom was spacious and the walk in shower was a treat. The hotel was ideally located at Circular Quay. You could walk out and get on a ferry in no time at all. And opposite to the Ferry stations were the Bus stops and taxi stop. And right on top, circular quay rail station. Perfect. Even better was the Botanical gardens on the other side for which you could take the hotel exit onto Macquarie Street. The gardens were absolutely incredible. A must for anyone. Things to do and remember: If you want to travel get the necessary passes that you require (available from most travel counters) - a tip: on Sundays you can get a family fun-day pass for 2dollars 50 per person. Perfect for the long trips! If you need tourist advice, their is a centre at the rocks and another situated at Darling harbour. However at Circular Quay their is a fine gentleman in a kiosk in front of Starbucks - so give him a shout! Contrary to a lot of reports - Sydney was expensive. Food was double to what we pay here in the UK. Shopping was expensive - so you have to look around before you buy! However under the Sydney Plaza there is a eating area consisting of various food outlets - try that, we found it cheaper than restaurants. The Queen Victoria building in Sydney bought back memories of home and of the grand Victorian designs that have been so central to the architecture of London - give it a try for breakfast or lunch as well as shopping. Also in the basement is a Starbucks - where you will meet the finest staff. If only all coffee shops were that appealing! If you are flying - especially with kids - take the A380, heaven! Subsequently take flights into Australia where you get there at night time - we got there in the morning and practically slept all day! We would seriously recommend everyone to see Sydney by walking where possible. We walked from Circular Quay (CQ) to Darling Harbour and all around the centre - Hyde Park was a blast - the war memorial profound and do the walk between the lights at night (you'll know what I mean when you see it!). We went to north Sydney and walked across the Harbour bridge, past the Observatory which was a treat! We took a day out to Taronga Zoo and walked Bradley's head - Taylors Bay - Chowders Bay and it was amazing! But be sure to have your walking boots on because it is a very challenging walk! We walked Watsons bay and all the way around to the lighthouse - we wanted to walk down to Bondi - but it started raining!(If you fancy getting to Bondi and don't want to walk - you can do so by catching a bus from there). At Watsons bay their is a delightful fish and chip shop - so lunch is recommended - also their is a park nearby and a play area for the kids . We went to Rose Bay and eventually walked to Bondi but didn't have enough time to walk to Coogee beach - another one for next time! However their are some lovely coffee and bakery shops (at Rose Bay), so don't forget to give them a try. Bondi was beautiful - funny because I thought it would always be more hip - but it was pleasant more than anything. And their are enough shops to keep everyone happy. We missed Manly, Palm beach which are to the North, and the Blue mountains which are to the east. We just did not have enough time to pull everything off! (oh well just have to save that for next time too then!) ANZ bank is the best bank to exchange money (their is a charge of 8 dollars though), but here is something we found - it is better to take Australian dollars from here - especially if you do not have to pay commission. Rates are just as competitive and at times better! Do not go into the currency exchange shops - they charge you a commission and a fee on top for changing the money!!! At the rocks on Friday and Saturday their is a market - perfect for fresh food and drink. Try the Turkish Gozleme - delicious. Also at the rocks centre is a sweet shop called Sticky - making fresh sweets and lollipops - really fun for the kids! Again we also missed the Sydney cricket ground and the ANZ stadium. If you have time that is a must. If you can get to any of Bills restaurants (restaurants that are owned by the renowned chef Bill Granger), then please do - the food is brilliant. I think I have covered most of what I can pass on. Sydney was five stars and the hotel was perfect. However just before I go, I do have one gripe. Again, their wasn't enough entertainment channels for children at the hotel. However that isn't an excuse for not getting there - after everything I have said I truly am lost for words, until you don't go and see Sydney for yourself you'll never know what you are missing. What are you waiting for then?

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: miszkinkz
Reviews.Content: The location is right on Circular Quay... everything is pretty much walking distance from the hotel ie: opera house (2min), the rocks (5mins) and etc... If not, the bus stop, train station and the ferry marina is a few feet from your doorstep. In the room its pretty sound proof, never really hear the outside unless we opened the balcony door. The staff is VERY friendly and would try to accomodate your needs, as mentioned no request is ever too big. We needed transformers and adaptors for our electornics they were able to let us borrow one free of charge. The hotel itself is not huge but the room is very spacious, we had the Harbour view suite. We loved the jacuzzi tub and the breathtaking view at night, sunset & sunrise. It is a bit pricey for an average traveler but you sure could find some great deals. We booked the hotel through our travel agent and wish I would've done it myself a couple of weeks later when it was $250AUD less per night due to a promotion they were having! I suggest booking it on your own, travel agents cannot book "advance purchase rates" because of they would not get as much commission, therefor they can only honor the "best available rate" IF they offer price match. But this hotel is DEFINITELY worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Magic night, best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Vegemite1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Quay Grand on Friday night, to celebrate my engagement, booking a "harbour view" room. The whole experience was awesome and it was literally the best place I've ever stayed at! First highlight was the large balcony overlooking the Quay. We spent hours out there watching the ferries come and go, tucking into some of the complimentary fruit platter and champagne that was kindly delivered by the hotel staff. From the balcony we could see some of the other notable hotels that I'd been considering for this special night - the Mariott, the Shangri-La, and the Intercontinental - but none of these hotels have balconies (as far as we could see anyway), and I was really glad I chose the Quay Grand!! Second highlight was the pool and gym area, beautifully modern with water right to the edge, deliciously warm and it has fantastic views as well. Only criticism was that the spa adjacent to the pool wasn't working (on Sat the 19th Sept) - but this was OK as there was a Spa in our room that easily caters for two people :-) While we didn't have dinner at the Quay Grand, we did enjoy breakfast on Saturday the 19th Sept - I'd booked a $525 parking/harbour view and breakfast for two deal, but I was wondering what would appear on our bill since we went a bit overboard at breaky. Several rounds of coffee while reading the paper, two full breakfasts and two sides each, but there was no additional charge on the bill - I was pleased to see that it really was all included in the rate. The final highlight was the quality of the staff - extremely friendly, no request is too difficult, and they are very proud of their #1 ranking on trip adviser. I would definitely go back, it was absolutely awesome - the only thing preventing me from staying there more regularly is the AUD$525/night rate. But for those really special occasions, I can't think of anywhere else I'd rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best place in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Mel7mm
Reviews.Content: 12 days here - no complaints whatsoever - any problem/query - just ask & it's sorted! Location can't be beat - everything is on the doorstep, but close the windows and you hear nothing! Fantastic, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms, near perfect experience. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 13black
Reviews.Content: We stayed at QGS for 8 nights upon our arrival in Australia. Without wishing to repeat what others have said, we found it an excellent hotel and experience, with our only "negatives" being at the periphery. Positives includes: * Impossible to beat location - stone's throw from all Circuar Quay ferries and train station * Great suites, including good sized lounge and bedroom plus fully equipped kitchen with utility facilities (washer/dryer) and bathroom, including jacuzzi (bog enough for 2) * Ample storage space throughout * Satellite TV including premium sports channels (in lounge and bedroom) * Quiet rooms (we did not hear any noise from the bustling Quay when doors/windows shut) * Privacy - in the sense that we were able to exit and enter the hotel directly on Circular Quay and therefore only went through reception when checking in and out. This really does give one the feeling of having one's own apartment in Sydney * We had little interaction with staff but when we did, all were polite and helpful Negatives (none of which we intend should put anyone off staying at QGS): * No free broadband/internet access - though this is an issue throughout Australia/NZ we have found. At these rates, they really ought to consider pricing internet into the room rates. For those of us from the Europe/US, having to pay for what we now regard as a "commodity" leaves something to be desired * On our third night, we found a 2.5 inch cockroach in the kitchen. This was dealt with immediately by the night manager and this was the only incident we had or observed. In fairness to the Hotel, the patio door to our balcony had been left open by the cleaners, which may explain this. * We had to call house-keeping and ask them to ensure that our room was vaccumed on a couple of occaisions, which though not a huge deal, was slightly disappointing for a hotel of this calibre. * In the bathroom, a gap in between the floor and the bottom of the door to the walk-in double shower means that it is prone to flooding the remainder of the bathroom floor. Again, this is something that a hotel of this calibre should be able to spot and rectify In summary, this is a top hotel and we'd recommend it to anyone without hesitation based on our usage (ie. bed only) - we did not use any of the restaurant, bar or pool.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: holicrazy
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go to Australia for a very long time and last year my wife and I made it , alot of thought and planning went into our stay and generally we made the right choices. Our first port of call was Sydney and our accommodation was Grand Quay Suites,a better choice could not have been made. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly , the apartment was great with all you needed , we booked a harbour view room which was well worth the extra money the view over Circular Quay and the harbour bridge could not be beaten.the location of this property ,between The Rocks and The Botanical Gardens was superb.Sydney itself is very walker friendly and you can visit a great many places on foot, the locals even help you if you get lost, This property is not cheap but if you want that special time then we would highly recommend that you look into this place. When it came time to leave we felt we had not stayed long enough and although we were going on a cruise along the coast for 12 days we wished we had longer here. On our return to Sydney after the cruise we had booked another property to spend 3 days I only wish we had returned to the Grand Quay Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfict Honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: Fahad_and_Fatma
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon trip across Australia and it was one of the best places, the staff were veeeeery helpful and they will do any thing you ask for if the can the suite was veery clean and the view is amazing from the harbour veiw suite

Reviews.Title: “Don't choose anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: JaynePiper
Reviews.Content: We booked this through the recommendations from Tripadvisor. Everything is fantastic about this place and the fact that you have an outside balcony overlooking circluar quay has got to be tops. Don't have the gardens suites - spend the bit extra and have the harbour bridge, circular quay and sunset views - amazing. Loved the fact that, after 3 weeks travelling, there is a washer and a dryer (women love this kind of facility guys!) Could not be faulted!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: OzDownunderSydney
Reviews.Content: Quay Grand was without a doubt exceptional! We chose this location for my partners birthday night away from home. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we departed, the staff could not be faltered. Service was the best. Prices were just right and the view was mind blowing! We will recommend Quay Grand to everybody!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Sydney...Best Service Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Profguy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a high quality hotel, excellent service, and a location that cannot be beat, the Grand Quay is the place for you. The rooms are suites and large by any standard. We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 4 nights at the start of our vacation and in a two bedroom suite the night before departing, which bookended an eleven day trip. The price is high, but the so is the quality of service and there is no better address. Out the front door is the Royal Botanical Gardens, 10 feet from the back door is the Circular Quay boat dock, and 100 meters from the end of the building is the Opera House entrance. You cannot beat the views. On one side you face the harbor and the other you overlook the botanical gardens. In either case, it is beautiful. We enjoyed sleeping with the curtains open with a view of the bridge. The facility also doubles as a long term residence so you may be in a room adjacent to a permanent tenant. If you want exclusivity and quiet in a prime location, look no further. If you are looking for touristy hustle and bustle, try something in Darling Harbor. In a book I bought listing the top 10 places to visit in Sydney, the Grand Quay is within five blocks of most of them. By international standards, the rooms are very clean and well maintained, however, during the second stay we were moved to a larger room because housekeeping failed to fully clean our assigned room. It was likely an innocent oversight, and it was definitely remedied to our satisfaction quickly, with a follow up after our visit. The highlight of our stay was the Head Concierge, David. He is likely the best concierge we have ever seen. Like all good concierges, David provided detailed information about all our excursions, but took the extra step of making all the arrangements so we need only show up. He saved us a fortune in tours by planning out details on our activities down to the time, location and payment. He had a rental car for us at the front door when we drove to the mountains and arranged for its return. Talk about service. Even better, he billed everything right back to our room, so we handled all expenses at checkout, which was quick and easy. He made pre-trip contact, took care of all details on site, and even followed up after our visit. I found it odd, however, that the rest of the front desk staff appeared to do double duty as front desk clerk and concierge, when David was off duty. They provided excellent service and even had cash ready to give a cab driver, who could not make change for a $100 AUD. That was impressive. The only drawback was their lack of concierge skills. It is an area for improvement. For a reviewer who did not get a paper, did you fill out the registration form at arrival? There was a box to check for which papers you wanted delivered. I saw lots in the hallway. This may have been user error. The food in the hotel restaurant was good, but a bit pricey, as was all the food in Australia. The pool and exercise room were very small and unimpressive, but not a concern for us since we were not in Sydney for the pool. Price is clearly an issue when traveling in Australia. It is not as expensive as London, but close. The hotel is very expensive, but comparable for a boutique hotel with this level of service and location. You rarely saw any other guests at the front desk and you always felt like you had the place all to yourself, despite being near full. The facility has some permanent residents in rooms on the same floor as hotel guests. I do not see this as a problem, but found it odd. I guess with condo size rooms and a prestigious address it is a smart business move on the part of management. Provided you do not suffer from sticker shock, the Grand Quay should be at the top of your list when visiting Sydney. We will definitely stay there again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller200203
Reviews.Content: after seeing the good reviews on this hotel I decided to try it out. The location is superb especially when weather fine like it has been last couple of days. the harbour view suite I have is great. So really like this place so far. Complaints? well, not many but would have been nice to have morning paper outside door and I didn't think the in-room breakast choices looked all that tempting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay, really worth treating yourself to staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca019
Reviews.Content: We decided to book 2 'posh' nights while visiting Sydney and opted for Quay Grand Suites and it really lived up to it's name! Right from checking in with the reception staff so friendly and helpful, no air of uppetness or arrogance you get like in England when staying in nice hotels. We booked a harbour view room, it was so comfortable and luxurious I didn't want to go out! The view from the balcony was amazing, looking out over the harbour and seeing the bridge with a glass of wine was bliss! Breakfast was included in our deal, make sure you check how much you're entitled to incase you go over as you will be charged the excess, food was lovely though! The pool was clean and lovely, swimming and still looking out over the harbour was great! All in all worth a bit of a spend and just made my time in Sydney even better!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a staff that may be unrivaled the world wide, why would anyone stay anywhere else? I would have no idea.”
Reviews.Author: Hgood1
Reviews.Content: I researched scores of Sydney hotels before settling on the Quay Grand Suites Hotel. I had narrowed it down to the Park Hyatt and Quay Grand, but Quay Grand had the Park Hyatt beat in just about every way. I was traveling with a friend and we were received by CHLOE at the front desk. She was charming and had the most sparkling personality I've witnessed at a front desk. As it turned out, my friend and I were meant to meet the next day with a film producer of great note, who's most awarded film was one we'd not seen yet. The film was made in the 1990s. It was 8pm the night before our meeting, and we had no idea how we'd get to see this film. NIGEL, who also worked the front desk, went to insane extremes to find the film for us. He found a copy at a video store that was about to close. He actually got the video store owner to keep his shop open for us for long enough to secure the film. Problem was it was on video.
