(Note: the Quay Grand Suites actually has DVD players in their rooms--very nice. Nigel managed to track down a video player for us, took it up to our room as we went to fetch the video, and had it set up for our return. That's a crazy level of service. But the service just continued on at a level I've have never witnessed at a hotel,ever. And I was the front office supervisor once at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York, one of the most famous five stars in the world. If we needed a taxi, front desk staff would run out onto the street and get us one in no time. If we wanted a petting zoo appointment to get near a koala, they took care of it. When there was a malfunction of our heating unit, they moved us up to an even better room. Mind you, you can not get a bad room at this property. They're actual apartments with separate huge bedrooms with sweeping floor to ceiling views. The apartments are funished with full size washers and dryers so you can do your wash while on a long journey down under. Can you do this at the Park Hyatt? You can't. The Park Hyatt wanted double the money for a plain old room with a bed in it. For half the price, at this property, you get a full kitchen, a dining room, and living room, the hugest spa tub and shower, and service that will make you wanting to move in. DAVID at the front desk was also insanely helpful and I just really still can't believe just how above and beyond he went for me and my friend who was traveling with me. The location is ideal. Though you are in a big city, you feel like you're on an island of your own away from the skyscrapers. The harbour side rooms are well worth springing for. I totally agree with another reviewer on here, you can sit all day and night and just be mesmerized by the ferries going back and forth. So beautiful. The balconies on which to sit are very ample and comfy. Forget what another reviewer said on here about room service and the picture posted. Room service food was mighty delicious and the portions were generous. They had the craziest good cheeeburger. It was huge with excellent quality cheese and bacon on it. It was topped with pineapple and beet root. Yummy. The hummus and eggplant dip you could not fault. The ice creams, heavenly. THE POOL is indoors and one of the few around town to be indoors. It was winter, and the heated indoor pool was a nice luxury and big enough to do laps in. The hotel is surrounded by scores of fine restaurants and street vendors with fish and chips and Royal Copenhagen ice cream. There is street entertainment along the quay and it's as fun a scene to watch as Venice Beach in California. If you're pleasant to the staff here, there's nothing they won't do for you. Whoever is managing this place deserves great credit fot the superb staff he or she employs. The level of caring will be something you will never forget. We felt like we were staying with friends. Well, wait, would my friends go to the legths of this hotel staff? Hmm...I'm not so sure. I kind of like checking out other hotels in the area of the one I'm staying in. as I travel about...I cannot for the life of me see why you would stay anywhere else in Sydney. If you do stay elsewhere, you've made a big mistake and used poor judgment. (P.S. the soundproofing of rooms is excellent and blocks out well the sounds of the city when you are trying to sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room with brilliant views”
Reviews.Author: holidayseeker_9
Reviews.Content: Short stay with family - 3 teenage sons. Great deal on room by selecting mid week stay through internet. Room was a great size and the chidren were spellbound by the view. We could watch all the harbour activities day and night. Hotel staff generally helpful. Location made it a bit of a walk for meals at night but having stayed at Darling Harbour previously, I would choose Quay West in preference any time again. Kids rated it as the best accommodation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: 2munsters
Reviews.Content: First time in Sydney, stayed here after reading reviews on trip advisor, so happy we did. The best location in Sydney, seriously! Right on the bay, lovely harbour views, steps away from the Opera House and great dining, check out Aria. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST View & great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: joneah
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Quay last November for a week. The view from our room was unbelievable. Our suite was very nice. All of the furnishing were new and it was very clean. This place is also right in the middle of all of the places you would want to visit. We walked to the Opera house, parks, loads of shopping. We called to get reservations at on of Sydney's premier restaurants " The Quay" and could not get.in We call the concierge, an he got us in no problem. The staff also helped us book some great day trips as well. This hotel was a little more than we were looking to spend, but turned out to be worth every penny. We are returning to Sydney this November, and will stay at The Quay Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room,location,service”
Reviews.Author: mrsgQld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one week for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The location and facilities at the Quay Grand are excellent. We had a spacious one bedroom suite with harbour view. The bed was very comfortable, large bathroom with spa, excellent outside patio area - where you could sit and watch the harbour bridge and the ferry's at circular quay. The advantage of having a laundry was also a plus with a one week stay. Trains into the city are right at your doorstep, or we often walked up George St (approx 15min) to the main shopping precinct. Staff were friendly and efficient. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room and location; spotty service”
Reviews.Author: ken39LA
Reviews.Content: You could not find a better located hotel in Sydney; right on Circular Quai and around the corner from the opera house. Room was spacious and clean. Service could have been better; one day no service at all until we called at 6 pm; on the last day they forgot to make the wake up call. On the other hand, the people at the desk were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bondi_Rimski
Reviews.Content: My partner hadn't been to Sydney before so I thought I'd treat him with harbour view room. I'm very happy with the decision. A great experience, with nothing to fault. At $350 Aus per night I thought it was reasonably priced (for what you get). It's a shame that the price for the next night (Friday) was scheduled to jump to nearly $500 (but hey it's a supply and demand market) and was consequently put out of my price range. A quick shift up to the Radisson solved Friday night's accommodation dilemma. It's an easy to recommend choice.

Reviews.Title: “Took my breath away!”
Reviews.Author: Kbel3
Reviews.Content: Wow! I booked this accommodation for myself and two girlfriends for our first (annual) girls weekend in Sydney and I was so glad that I did. After doing detailed research to find the "Quintessential Sydney Experience' for our stay, the Quay Grand was picked based on the positive reviews here at TA. And the reviews were spot on! We shared a one bedroom Harbour View room which was stunning. We loved the fact that the balcony opened onto Circular Quay and we could watch the ferries come and go. Sipping champagne while watching the lights on the bridge come to life was a true highlight. The room was spacious and contemporary with 2 LCD TV's a full size fridge and dishwasher! The bedroom was huge with lots of storage space and the spa bathroom was very generous - even enough room for 3 make-up addicts to share! My only gripe, and its a small one, is that I had to pay an extra $55 (on top of the $444 per night) to use the fold-out bed which I had to make up myself. It seemed a bit steep considering there was no linen provided (had to call for it) and I had to set it up and put it away every day. I've taken one star off service and value for that but its a small gripe considering how superb this place is overall. We used the pool and spa which we had to ourselves in the evening and were impressed by. The location is outstanding with easy access to transport of all types and a quick train trip direct from the airport. All 3 of us love the Quay Grand and we plan to make it our regular base in Sydney! Well worth the cost for the view alone; the lovely interior is an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to leave”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: This really is a superb hotel either for business or leisure (although we'd hate to be there on business and have to interrupt the day with work!) The rooms are contemporary and very well appointed: - separate bedroom and lounge, both with views across Circular Quay to THE Bridge, - kitchenette with cooker, microwave, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer - bathroom with corner spa plus separate shower - very private balcony: ok, maybe not so private if anyone glances up from the tourist throngs on Circular Quay - so behave :) Everything about the room and the hotel in general was in perfect condition and gave the impression of having been recently refurbished. The amenity areas are very modern and built for the views - restaurant, bar, pool, spa and gym. It is a fairly small hotel so we found the facilities to be very relaxed and uncrowded. The outlook from the harbour-view rooms is west and therefore directly into the setting sun so they've added sensible features like an electrically operated outside blind that filters the sun while you enjoy your champagne and nibbles on the balcony. Tough life eh? For daytime sleeping there are blackout curtains. With the balcony door closed the sound attenuation is reasonably good but you'll still enjoy the background toot-toot of the departing ferries. This hotel is in the heart of Sydney's tourist scene so expect crowds outside, particularly at weekends. Circular Quay is the main harbour-ferry terminal so you get easy access by water to other hot-spots like Darling Harbour, Luna Park, Taronga Zoo and Manly beaches. There is also a train station, buses and plenty of taxis adjacent to the quay. Walking to the Opera House, the Rocks and the Botanical Gardens is 5 minutes. Walking to the CBD and Darling Harbour is 15-20 minutes. Just to the left of the lower hotel entrance (Circular Quay entrance) there is a glass lift that takes you up to the walkway alongside the Cahill Expressway. From there it is a fairly flat walk to the Harbour Bridge and across to the northern shore. 30 minutes of gentle walking will get you over to the opposite side, not including an extra hour for photo stops. Part-way across the bridge you can take another lift up to the top of the pylon for superb views and some exhibits on building the bridge. When you get to the north side you can catch a train or ferry back. And finally a comment on the staff - they were great. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy, and the desk staff were always friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We had a great stay and will plan to return when we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalshowers
Reviews.Content: My teenage son & I made a return visit to the Quay Grand having previously stayed there 2 years ago in a 2 bedroom Opera Hse/Garden view room. We thought that visit was wonderful & our view lovely. This time we chose a harbour view room & were absolutely delighted...it would be had to go back to a garden view! It was wonderful absorbing the harbour life from our balcony. On both occassions the staff were excellent and the units spotless. The Quay Grand is close to every form of transport you may require as well as the Opera Hse, Art Gallery and the Rocks to name a few. There are numerous restaurants & cafes to cater for most tastes only minutes from your door. I highly recommend the smorgasboard 'feasts' at the Shangri-La Hotel..(keep room for dessert), as well as the Orient Hotel where the food is good and at a reasonable price. Both are in the Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent room!”
Reviews.Author: Psychicdante
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault it. Great hotel!! Me & my girlfriend had a great time : )

Reviews.Title: “Looing forward to staying again”
Reviews.Author: greatyellowslug
Reviews.Content: Bit of a belated review, but thought I'd add my two cents. Stayed in Sydney last year for a wedding, plus a couple days extra for leisure. Extensively researched on tripadvisor where looked best, and we chose this one based on its reports of great service, nice looking rooms, proximity to the wedding, great views, great location, and the bonus of having a spa in our suite. Felt that we absolutely chose the best place to stay in every aspect of what we wanted from our experience. The room exceeded expectations - modern, clean, comfortable, awesome beds, fabulous views, great kitchen, well soundproofed, nice spa. The service - which I value as much as the quality of room - was impeccable - I expected it to be a bit stuffy, but they were down to earth, friendly yet professional - I don't think you could find much better service anywhere else. Only a couple of issues, very small ones - when I discovered the ironing board missing from the room and it was promptly brought up with an apology (that great service again), when i started ironing, a little cockroach scuttled out from the ironing board - so it might be an idea for them to have more vigilant pest control where they store these items? I didnt see another one our whole stay though, so not a big deal. The other very minor thing is that when we would have a shower, the water would leak across the floor flooding the bathroom floor and pool there, so when you would go into the bathroom afterwards it was a bit of a nuisance. We ended up using a couple of towels to help mop up the floor each time, but of course it would be better not to have this inconvenience. We are planning another trip to sydney soon, and I have been researching places to stay again, but nowhere seems to come up to anywhere near the standard of this hotel. It is pretty pricey but you definately get what you pay for. Other places might be great, but can be a gamble - with this place you are assured of a wonderful, trouble free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Yarmnomad
Reviews.Content: My fourth time in Sydney and at last my husband and I have found the perfect home from home. The views are outstanding and I would defy anyone to find a better located hotel. 2 mins walk to the ferry and railway station. Withing walking distance of shops, The Bridge, The Opera House, The Rocks, The Botanical Gardens, Darling Harbour. Five minutes walk to the tram for Sydney Fish Market for the best seafood on the planet. Bars and restaurants are within a five minute walk. We have tavelled extensively round the world and Quay Grand Suites takes some beating for it's location. I would recommend it to anyone. The extra that you might pay compared to other hotels is worth every penny so save that bit extra for your holiday and book it. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best, just not room service!”
Reviews.Author: 13b
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good reviews of this place. It is just the most beautful view. The staff were fantatsic, true 5 star service. Do check your bill at the end, as they added something twice & tried to charge carparking ($35) which was included in room cost. The room service, see my photos but a 5cm steak for $39 & a 8cm steak for $40 with NO sides, no chips no saled NOTHING. and it wasn't even the best steak i've ever had. it was very nice, but not worth the money even if i was a trillionaire! Also watch what you order for breakfast, we had to get help with ordering as we found the layout VERY confusing & even then it was wrong!! BUT if you don't get room service & you check your bill - worth every cent!!!! Just get the cheap deals :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Goblin_2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last part of our honeymoon in Sydney and stayed at the Quay. Overall, customer service and location were excellent. If you do stay here I would recommend the harbor view. The location is perfect to view the bridge, opera house, the rocks, Darling Harbor, access to the ferries, etc... The room itself was large with a full kitchen as well as a washer/dryer. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 for a reason! Great Location in the CENTER of everything.”
Reviews.Author: captaingary
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a harbor view room on the 9th floor. This place is has a view of the Circular Quay, Bridge, Opera House and is in the center of everything. The rooms are luxurious! They give you a robe and slippers. Reception was excellent. It cost us just over $250 (USD) a night and was a fairly good value. We had tried to stay when the Queen Mary II came into the harbor but the room was $655 (USD) a night!!! WOW. These must be individually owned but they are nice. There is a granite kitchen, W/D, seperate living room, KING bed, 2 Flat Screens, stereo, DVD player, you name it. It's great to sit out on the deck with a glass of wine and watch all the action on the harbour. The rooms are fairly well insulated so you only hear the occassional ferry horn or passenger ship horn at night. We were there, fortunately, when only 1 day had a cruise ship. The harbor area is super busy then (restaurants, shops, ferries) and the view is of the port side of a BIG ship. If you can ascertain if a ship will be there, try to stay somewhere in Darling Harbour instead. The only criticism I had, was that the housekeeper left a greasy, rust stained large wet rag on top of one of my shirts. Woah! There was a little marital misunderstanding that evening! YIKES! Anyway, we had left a $5 tip for the housekeeper each day and she did NOT take it the next two days for some reason. Also, the restaurant had bad service and burned my breakfast badly. Therefore, I would NOT recommend the restaurant. There are plently of non-Hotel affiliated restaurants in the area for your dining pleasure. Also, there is a Cole's just up the block for the few times you might want to save $100 (USD) and dine at the hotel. The kitchen is well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views, Perfect Location, Lovely Staff, Brill room”
Reviews.Author: HilaryLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I picked this one off tripadvisor and was a bit concerned as am normally into boutique hotels and this looked a little chainy for me but I need not have worried. Although the rooms won't win style awards and the marble in the bathrooms is a bit 1990s these are lovely apartments. They are hugely spacious with a really well equipped kitchen. The beds are super comfy but the best bit is the lounge with a beautiful view across to the harbour bridge - I could have sat there all day and night. Hotel is really well located - an easy walk into the CBD, right next to the ferries to manly, watsons etc, right by the gorgeous botanic gardens and a short cab ride to Darlinghurst and potts point. Service was impeccable - lots of staff who were on hand day and night. A proper 24 hour room service menu - after a late night partying the fish and chips were excellent. Whilst in Sydney we looked at a pile of other hotels and this was by far the best. Lovely pool. Only gripe is that they kept the free weights in the gym locked away but thats only a prob if you are a huge gym bunny Finally ask for a high floor as I think lower ones will get a bit of street noise

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location. Absolute Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne61Birmingham
Reviews.Content: Our 2 bedroom appartment overlooking the harbour and Circular Quay exceeded my most hopeful expectations. Plasma screens in the sitting room and bedrooms. Fabulous kitchen and laundry area.The appartment was spotlessly clean. It was 43degrees outside but the aircoditioning gave us a cool retreat from the hot sun. The staff were extremely helpful. I had a back problem while I was there and the kind man on reception not only rang around to find me a chiropractor but even offered to take me round there in a wheelchair. I preferred to hobble round myself but it was very thoughtful. No charge for this. There is a great swimming pool and jacuzzi (also helpful for the back). Watching the great cruise liners berth from your bedroom window and sitting on the balcony watching the twinkling lights of cicular quay reflecting in the water was pure magic. I loved it. It is quite expensive but the old adage 'you get what you pay for' is certainly true here

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for our wedding - a fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: rachscott1
Reviews.Content: After spending weeks constantly reviewing Sydney hotels, I decided on the Quay Grand, and what a choice it was - the room was amazing - fully equipped kitchen, spacious lounge, bedroom and bathroom and views to die for! As we were in Sydney for our wedding, we wanted something special and we certainly got it. The hotel staff were great on our wedding day, helping out with hairdressers/photographers etc coming to the room, and the hotel was ideally located for where we got married and got picked up by the boat we hired for our reception. I lived in Sydney a few years ago and always liked the look of this hotel from the outside, and don't think I would be able to come back to Sydney (which we plan to do as soon as we can) and not stop here. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: TPW2
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at this wonderful apartment hotel right in the heart of Sydney at Circular Quay. The apartment was extremely comfortable and clean with all amenities you could wish for. The location is second to none, and when sitting on the balcony our view was of the harbour and the bridge and just 2 minutes from the Opera House and The Rocks.. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient and we would thoroughly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the great city of Sydney. Deserves it's 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: jjnico
Reviews.Content: Great, great place. Sophisticated, clean property. Views to die for and right next to ferry routes and trains to get around. Don't rent a car...it's not needed if you're touring around the city. Multiple bars and restaurants right at your door step.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3dom
Reviews.Content: this was the 4th apt/hotel we stayed at in Sydney during a one month stay in Jan2009. It was clearly the best. location is a few steps from the ferries, trains and the opera house. the room was also exceptional. we had the garden view side, which had nice views of the botanical gardens, intense morning sunrises and even a slight opera house view. macquarie street below was however much louder than i anticipated (rumbling harley's at odd hours). staff was great. the only negative was gym, pretty minimal; and the spa/hot tub which needed new tile

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Quay Grand Suites Sydney”
Reviews.Author: GoulburnSkydiver
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked our parents into the Quay Grand Suites as a gift for them to celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary. This review is based on the feedback received from Mum and Dad. They rated this hotel as the best they have stayed at anywhere in the world based on standard of service, room facilities, hotel location and the attitude of staff which is to do everything possible to meet the needs of the guest. They arrived slightly early but this was no problem with an early check in. They said the views of the Harbour Bridge were stunning and the quality of the in room dinner and breakfast superb. We had a lot of communication with the hotel to arrange this night and everything that was promised was delivered. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the management and staff of the hotel for their efforts in making this a memorable event.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: G_Roam_The_Gnome
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned international business traveler, I am accustom to many different hotel offerings and location features. My wife and I recently chose Australia as our honeymoon getaway and opted to stay at the Quay Grand Suites based upon it's prime location near the tourist attractions, ferries, restaurants, pubs, and outdoor market at the area called "The Rocks". I cannot overstate the prime positioning of this hotel in relationship to all of the transportation or night spot options. The hotel is truly perfectly positioned for a leisure getaway and is 3 minutes walking distance from water ferries, local and regional train stations, and a 5 minute walk to the iconic Opera House. The "Rocks" district, famous for old pubs, restaurants, and shopping is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We found the staff to be responsive and helpful, polite, and ready to assist with all of our needs. The lobby bar offered a fantastic view and we would, without hesitation, recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on leisure to Sydney. This hotel is located in the heart of the activity and is alone in it's unique positioning. We had considered other options, such as the Marriott, Four Seasons, and the Westin, however none offered the location of this hotel. This is a must-stay hotel in Sydney. We had a harbour suite with a view of the Harbour Bridge and a kitchenette. The balcony was fantastic and was a great evening hang out spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AmY209
Reviews.Content: Huge suite with wonderful view of the harbour. Fully equipped apartment, you could live there. Excellent staff and service. Good pool with a hot tub and a small gym. The restaurant is not worth bothering with but that is not the point of this type of hotel. Couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sfwood
Reviews.Content: The Quay Suites are terrific. This was my third visit to Sydney but first at this hotel and I chose it because of reviews here. Each Suite is like a small apartment. Gorgeous layout, great furnishings, huge baths with fully-supplied kitchens and a small washer/dryer and, the best part, large balconies overlooking Circular Quay (the main harbor, bridge and Opera House area) or the park. This isn't your typical large lobby hotel. Reception is low key but very very friendly and efficient. There is a very nice restaurant and bar in the hotel but 20 feet from the lower level are numerous restaurants, food stands, ice cream, etc. I was concerned with noise level being located smack dab on the main ferry terminal but the rooms are very well insulated and very quiet. The views are stunning (see attached) and the rooms are wonderful. Highly recommended with my thanks to the staff who treated us so well.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! 5 Star Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ExpatinCairo
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was fantastic. Our suite looked directly out at the Harbour Bridge and over the ferry terminal at Circular Quay. It was 2 mins walk to the Opera House & Botanical Gardens. Everything worked fanatsic for us as Circular Quay is a public transport hub with ferries, MRT and taxi ranks. We wished we were staying for New Year as the view of the fireworks would be amazing. The children enjoyed the street theatre on the Quay each time we went out, watching all the boats come and go and the lights at night from the bridge and Luna Park. We booked a 2 bedroom harbour view suite via the online hotel website. I guess the other rooms would look out onto the street/Botanical Ganrdens. We stayed here as part of a 3 week holiday in SIngapore & Australia. We stayed for 7 nights. We are a pretty fussy family and only stay in 5 Star accomodation. We booked a serviced apartment as opposed to 2 connecting hotel rooms as we wanted some kitchen flexibility with our children plus the washing machine/dryer was great. They were really spacious. It had a fully stocked fridge (which is chargeable) Also I found that the Quay Grand was in a better location with better prices than some of the hotel accomodations. Everything we needed was right on our doorstep..from supermarkets, Pharmacies, ATM's, restaurants etc., David Jones the department store and QVB are either a 15 min wlak or just 1 stop on the MRT. Prior to arrival there had been high winds and on the day of check in our apartment was no longer available as the balcony door had been damaged. It took them about 15 mins to sort everything out but all was fine. The Manager on reception was great. Whilst the Quay Grand suites do not have the same quantity of staff as a 5 Star hotel we had no issues whatsoever. Room Service was fast, there is a big restaurant on site, rooms were cleaned daily etc., I have to say this accomodation exceeded our expectaions. We met up with family Sydney and teh family members were also saying it was a fantastic location. We would stay here again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Accomodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Passport53
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about the Quay Grand is the location. Itâ€™s located on the harbor so when you walk out of the hotel, you are steps away from Sydneyâ€™s rail station and the main ferry hub, meaning you can get anywhere in the city very quickly. When you look across the harbor, you get a great view of the Sydney Harbor Bridge and when you look to your right, youâ€™ll see that you are just a few hundred yards from the Sydney Opera House. When you look out of the front of the Hotel, you will be facing the Royal Botanical Gardens, which are beautiful. You are less than a five minute walk from the Rocks District, where youâ€™ll find great dining and shopping. The staff was extremely polite and very attentive to our needs. My wife forgot several valuables when we left and the hotel kept them secured for two weeks until we could return to retrieve them. There is a nice bar on the second floor of the hotel that has a great view of Sydney Harbor and there are other restaurants and shops all within steps of the hotel. The rooms were extremely spacious and comfortable. Our room had a washer/dryer and complete kitchen. Internet access was also reasonably priced and very fast. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “yup, the best hotel in sydney”
Reviews.Author: loverofred
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the quay grand and it is ALWAYS exceptional. The staff are amazing and always greet me by name. The rooms are always beautiful and spacious, and ready on arrival. valet parking is great. hotel location is great. The quay grand always comes up a winner compared to any other hotel I have stayed at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Set-Up for Families”
Reviews.Author: HongKongKara
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay in a 2 bedroom apartment at the Quay Grand Suites in Sydney with my 2 small children (2 years and 8 months). I can't say enough good things about our stay. The location is ideal. It really could not be better. It is difficult to travel around Sydney by taxi with a baby (you must pre-order a special taxi with a car seat) so it was very convenient that we could get everywhere by walking or ferry. It was very handy having a kitchen and washer/dryer with the children too. Our view of the harbour was amazing and my 2 year old loved watching the big ships and ferries come in and out of the harbour. The staff was helpful and friendly too. I thought it was good value for money considering we would have had to get 2 connecting hotel rooms if we had stayed somewhere else and we wouldn't have had the convenient of the kitchen, living room, and washer/dryer. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Sydney with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Quay Grand Is The Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: Kat&Jase
Reviews.Content: For my birthday this year we planned to go to Sydney for 4 days/nights and wanted to splash out on somewhere special. We certainly weren't disappointed with our choice of accommodation. We stayed at the Quay Grand Suites in a 1 bedroom harbour view apartment and got a discounted rate on wotif.com. From the minute we arrived we were treated like VIP guests. We received a warm welcome from every staff member in the lobby and were escorted to our room on the 9th floor. We were blown away by how beautiful our apartment was but even more so by the view. To the left was the city, in front was the water and to the right was the Sydney Harbour Bridge, with Luna Park all lit up in the distance. We spent many a relaxing hour on our balcony, overlooking the water, watching the ferries come and go and the people on the street below us passing by as they went about their day. The king bed in our apartment was incredibly comfortable with plenty of fluffy pillows to choose from and the softest sheets we've ever had the pleasure of sleeping on. The sofa in the lounge converted into a queen bed, and was nice to laze about on during the day. There was a 4-seater dining table and fully equipped modern kitchen with top quality electrical appliances. The bathroom was large and included a shower and spa bath, which we took full advantage of on more than one occasion. Other reviewers have mentioned the noise of the ferries below from the apartment but with the balcony door closed we heard nothing. There are a number of shops and cafes nearby (our favourite was the Guylian Chocolate Cafe for their Belgian waffles and hot chocolates) and the Circular Quay rail and ferry stations are right on your doorstep. You can get to wherever you want to go without any trouble at all. And if you have any questions, the staff at Quay Grand are only too happy to help out. On the few occasions we required a taxi, one was flagged down for us within minutes by the friendly chap at reception, and always with a smile. On the day of my birthday my hubby and I headed out for breakfast and when we returned there was a chilled bottle of champers and a beautiful big basket of fresh fruit awaiting me as we entered the apartment. Along with it was a heartfelt birthday wish from the staff at Circular Quay. It was unexpected and very much appreciated. We did have a couple of small problems during our stay but nothing that bothered us too much. The door key was one of those plastic cards that you push in and pull out quickly but it failed to work for us so we were given a replacement. Unfortunately that didn't want to work either so it too was replaced. Third time was a charm and we didn't have any other problems after that. The other issue was the fridge. It decided to take a break one night and in the morning all of our food/drinks were hot. Reception got right onto it though and within the hour the fridge was in working order and many of our refreshments had been replaced. Overall we both highly recommend the Quay Grand Suites to anyone wanting 5 star accommodation, great views, friendly staff and an experience as wonderful as the city itself. We can't wait to go back and will return to the Quay Grand Suites without hesitation when visiting Sydney in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and View!”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide
Reviews.Content: After discounting this apartment hotel due to the cost, I relented later on and decided to just pay the extra, as it had received such good reviews on Trip Advisor. We are so glad that we did! On arrival at Circular Quay Station, it was just a short walk to the hotel, and we were greeted as though we were really important! After check-in, we were escorted to our apartment and shown where everything was. It was a one-bedroomed apartment, with the most amazing view of the harbour, the bridge, and the ferry terminal, with all the activity of the harbour contributing to the excitement of our situation. The view was brilliant both during the day, and at night. With the doors closed, there was really very little noise from the ferries and the hussle and bustle of the world below. The location could hardly be any better. Circular Quay Station is only a short walk from the hotel, and has a direct line to/from the airport and the rest of the city. As well, the ferries leave practically from your doorstep, to all areas of the harbour. The Opera House is also only a short stroll away. The only negative is that it is quite expensive, and doesn't seem to do many cheap deals online, but I guess they don't need to! I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a superb location and view, and would pay the extra to get a harbour view if finances permit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: mtnrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Harborside one bedroom suite for 5 days the beginning of September 2008. Since I got to the hotel at 8 a.m. I was hoping to have them watch my luggage and get access to the gym but they checked me right in and took me up to my room (no extra charge for checking in so early). The staff was always extremely helpful regardless of how simple or complex the question or the time of day/night. I would without hesitation recommend this hotel to family and friends. Although a little pricey, the location can't be beat and having a full kitchen and laundry facilities in my room definitely saved me money in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “sensational”
Reviews.Author: MadDogACT
Reviews.Content: Booked online from the Quay Grand website. From the moment we arrived, everything was excellent. The valet had our car parked and into our room in under 20 minutes. The rooms are brilliant, large, clean and very well appointed. We had a garden view room, which was better we thought than the Quay side, as there was no noiise and was very private. We will definately be going back, excellent value for money when you compare the location and the quailty of the accomodation with other leading five star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many five star places in Australia, but the service at this place was far beyond anything else we've experience in Australia. The staff were pleasant and helpful, without being snooty. The rooms were fantastic: great views, great amenities. And the location was perfect. Right in Circular Quay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bingo - Sydney's top hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a stunning view and position, and what a pleasure it was to stay here for five days whilst hubby was running a conference. I absolutely loved Quay Grand as we had booked a one bedroom suite overlooking Sydney harbour and the bridge. One would never ever tire of this view as itâ€™s stunning and also highly entertaining watching the ferries come and go. The hotel is located in absolute prime position just two minutes away from the Opera House and one minute from Circular Quay. The Botanical Gardens are across the road and the Rocks just a quick 5 minute stroll. Bingoâ€¦..Sydneyâ€™s top Hotel. Our apartment was roomy with a separate bedroom which looked directly out onto the water . The lounge combined dining room had spectacular views of Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge and with a glass of vino at night on the balcony we fell totally in love with our own city. The apartment also has a DVD player, broadband and two plasma TVâ€™s. The bathroom is spacious with a lovely spa bath and walk-in shower. The hotel has a fabulous bar located on the mezzanine level 3 called ECQ and its fun sipping cocktails overlooking our gorgeous city. The restaurant Quadrant is fine dining and expensive but we did enjoy our meal. There is also Eastbank Restaurant located on the ground floor which is great for a cheaper alternative which serves a lovely pizza or pasta. The indoor swimming pool is located on the 4th floor which is terrific as it also has a spa attached and two saunas and stream room. The staff were very helpful and cheerful. Sydney is a treasure chest , holding incredible richness and beauty in the fragments of the harbour and foreshores. The glistening fragments of light filtering over Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are truely enchanting. Sydney is a city full of playfulness, entertainment , sophistication, mixed with a lively cosmopolitan casual lifestyle. I highly recommend this hotel for location and its facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ssamra
Reviews.Content: I along with my wife and two sons (aged 16 & 14) stayed at Grand Quay Suites Sydney for five nights (May 11 to May 16,2008). After going through very positive reviews on tripadvisor.com we changed our booking to Grand Quay Suites Sydney. We checked in early at 8.00am.Our two bedroom apartment was not ready,as a good gesture by the reception staff we were given a one bedroom apartment straight away. From our apartment we enjoyed the best views of Harbour Bridge.The Sydney Opera House is just a minutes walk and everything(Sydney Ferries,local trains,taxis,buses) available at door step. The apartment was just like a home away from home with all the facilities and excellent upkeep. Would like to come back soon and highly recommend to anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ChiaTraveller
Reviews.Content: We love this place! We stayed here for the Australia Day long weekend as a weekend away and everything was perfect. We got to see fireworks, the hussle and bussle of the city, the ferries coming in and out and just the general beauty of the landmark Harbour Bridge. The service was great - the rooms were spotless and the right size. Everything worked perfectly. Great walking distance to everything. Would have no hesitation whatsoever recommending this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Great room”
Reviews.Author: micsgirl
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed in a 1brm harbour view suite for 4 days. It was fantastic. I'm not sure this location on Circular Quay could be bettered. The Quay Grand was fab. Sydney is virtually on your doorstep as it takes 1 minute to get to the ferries, trains and buses. If you have a travel pass,as we did($95 for a week, one adult and child for all buses trains and ferries plus the airport train both ways), you venture out every opportunity you have. We got ferries to places we wouldnt normally go (like Watsons Bay) because we could. We arrived at 9 am and were able to check in to our room straight away.The apartment (Rm 702)was perfect for us. Quite high up so nice view of the Harbour Bridge. No view of the Opera House because it is right next door! There was no noticeable noise from the ferrries and trains when the balcony door was shut and just a pleasant sound of people going about their business when it was open. Nice place to sit and people watch. Room service was great and very quick. The pool was very nice too. Lots of cafes right next door and a great movie theatre next door that shows art house sort of movies. We had an issue with the appliances not working in the kitchen(fuse had blown)but it was resolved quickly. The staff were friendly and showed an interest in what we had been doing. I loved it and cant wait to stay here again. Would be even nicer if it was a little cheaper but I would still return.

Reviews.Title: “Complete package”
Reviews.Author: Barratt
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed two nights while some home renovations were completed on our Sydney townhouse. We chose this property for its prime location and our knowledge of the good standards we could expepct from the Quay properties. Quay Grand is clean, comfortable and conventional. Our suite was well equipped and appointed overlooking Circular Quay. Air conditioning was challenged by the afternoon sun and blinds had to be kept drawn but generally it was fine. Check in / Check out personnel were friendly and did a fine job, other service areas were not of the same standard and dining room service could be more energetic.They don't sell their product appropriately, they don't draw you to the facility and the food and drinks don't have the touches that you would expect from a 5 star property charging top dollar. Looks as though Quay Grand is not really attempting to compete with the establishments available in the immediate precinct when it comes to food and beverage. Certanly a good accommodation choice in Sydney's CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BYRONIC
Reviews.Content: I cannot add any more superlatives, but I will- this is truly a great place to stay. My huge balcony overlooked Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour Bridge - particularly moving on 'sorry' day - as the Aboriginal flag flew alongside the Australian on the bridge. I only wish I had stayed longer than my 3 nights - it was truly a wonderful place in a perfect position. If you do stay with a family and do not wish to cook - try the excellent Chinese restaurant just along from the hotel towards the Opera House, it does takeaway if you ask - one meal from there will last you two nights!

HotelInfo.Name: Quay Grand Suites Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 61 Macquarie St | East Circular Quay, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
